No one leaves this place without decorating my armor with their bones!
Noctur must have managed to pass through. He would never lose to someone like you.
You must be from Mount Oblivion. I've heard dragons that live there hate Heroes.
I love seeing the fear in their eyes as I turn them into my accessories.
I wonder why he would go to Mount Oblivion. What can these bloodthirsty dragons offer him?
Woah, the Sky Palace! This place is enormous.
I bet he knows a lot about Dragon Bonds. He could tell me how I can help Noctur.
You! Young one! The Sky Palace is no longer safe. Beware of vicious creatures!
Lorekeeper Aranth! Let me help you defeat some of the creatures!
Thank you, young one! You saved my graying scales. I'm Aranth, the lorekeeper.
Can you tell me about Dragon Bonds. Especially if they go wrong?
You must have met Bonefang on your way. That dragon has always had a darker heart...
Most dragons experience the painful loss of their heroes. We live for centuries, unlike their kind.
I'm forming my very first Dragon Bond. I can't imagine losing it...
What advice could I give my friend who may have lost his Dragon Bond?
It is a blessing for a dragon to share a bond with a hero, no matter how fleeting.
This place is too hot even for a fire dragon like me.
I must have lost Noctur's trail...
Suddenly, Blaze senses murderous intent, and before he can react, a claw is tearing at his wing.
Not bad, little whelpling. You deserve to breathe fire for another day, even if you trespassed on my home.
Do you always attack others without asking any questions?
I let you live because I respect your burning will to fight.
But please refrain from testing me further.
Doubt starts to creep into Blaze's mind.
How could Noctur side with dragons like Doombringer?
Doombringer was so dangerous. I can't believe Noctur would ally with dragons like him.
The tear on my wing is only slowing me down. I need to find help.
Blaze! What are you doing here!
Lux! I'm looking for Noctur. He is on his way to Mount Oblivion!
Glad to see you're almost in one piece, my friend.
Follow me. We need to patch you up.
You can't convince me to go home, Lux.
I won't. I've seen you and Noctur grow together, and you're best friends.
The wound on your wing is starting to fester. Let me cure you with my light magic.
Thank you for healing me. Any advice for when I finally see Noctur?
No matter what, listen to what he has to say with an open mind. Trust that you know he has a good heart.
There's malice in the air. Blaze senses something hiding with murderous intent.
Come out. I can sense your conniving presence!
Don't you know how to have fun?
I'm tired of monsters like you, who like to attack without reason.
You are such a monster! How did you become this twisted?
Did you have a Dragon bond that went wrong?
Oh, I have a great Dragon bond! Just not with a hero.
I don't understand. What else can you have a Dragon bond with?
Oh, you naive little thing, not all humans are heroes.
My Dragon bond taught me the beauty of terror!
To see humans scream and run like helpless, brainless little critters is so much fun.
Blaze is left speechless. He never realized that you could have a Dragon bond with villains.
I sense a serene and focused dragon nearby. I hope they can point me to Mount Oblivion.
Blaze approaches a dragon that seems to be focused on a gemstone. Blaze waits in silence so as not to disturb the other dragon.
I appreciate your patience. May I help you?
May I ask, what you were doing with that jewel?
You are a curious one, aren't you?
I'm using this topaz to observe my hero and her family from afar in case they need me.
I've had a Dragon bond with this family for many generations.
Wow, that's really impressive! You're like a family guardian.
I'm on my way to Mount Oblivion, but I'd like to know which mountain it is.
Why would you want to go there? You don't seem like a dragon that doesn't believe in Dragon bonds.
I'm looking for my friend. I think he is going there.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
It's the darkest mountain, surrounded by the darkest clouds on the horizon.
Thank you! My name is Blaze, by the way. It was great meeting you!
I'm Ignis, good luck on your journey!
It's so beautiful here. So serene...
Yeah... don't you just love the sound of the waves?
Woah! I didn't sense you at all.
[Calm left head] No one can sense us when we hunt for prey.
[Angry right head] You idiots! Why would you tell him that he is our dinner?
[Angry right head] See what you did! No dinner for us!
[Calm left head] It's not my fault.
[Happy middle head] This dragon was too strong!
[Calm left head] I bet he doesn't taste good.
You three are crazy! Why would you eat other dragons?!
[Happy middle head] We have never tasted a fire dragon before. You have to taste everything once!
Woah, the flower fields are so colorful!
Suddenly, Blaze sees a dragon chased by a horde of flower monsters.
Yes! These angry blooms are trying to hurt me!
Please don't use dragon fire! It could set off a wildfire!
How does a dragon help without the use of fire? I need to think of something fast.
Your thorn skin came in really handy to damage those blooms!
Thank you for the help and for not using fire!
It's my duty to protect unique areas like this from destruction.
It must be challenging to not use any dragon fire.
It's worth it. Beautiful areas like this connect me to my hero, as we share the same duty of protecting nature.
My hero taught me that having something to protect makes you stronger.
This place is freezing! I need to pass by this area quickly.
Greetings... What is a fire dragon doing at the Nefarious Summit?
Great, another dragon trying to go to Mount Oblivion. You should turn back.
You can't enter without an invitation.
I can see Mount Oblivion from here.
Why would I need an invitation to enter? I could just fly there?
The mountain is guarded by dragons that won't let you enter.
How do you know about the invitation?
Many return here trying to enter without an invitation, and I'm tired of rude visitors.
I must try to enter without an invitation. I don't have a choice.
Hmmm... Maybe you could enter the mountain undetected through the Abyssal Chasm.
So this is the Abyssal Chasm. It looks really dark in here.
This might be the only way to reach Mount Oblivion without an invitation.
And the only way I'll find Noctur...
Blaze musters all his courage and dives into the darkness of the Abyssal Chasm.
As the mysterious dragon hovers before Blaze, he can't read her intentions. Is this dragon a friend or foe?
I'm looking for another way to enter Mount Oblivion. As I don't have an invitation.
I see. I'm a guardian of the mountain, I can't let you venture further.
Please, I'm just looking for my friend. A blade-winged purple dragon.
Noctur. He was invited, but you are not.
Without an invitation, your fate is sealed, Blaze.
It seems you have a strong will...
You are defeated. Let me pass! Now!
You are only here for Noctur, right?
Noctur hasn't entered Mount Oblivion yet.
He went to Sunshine Horizon. It's west of here.
I'm more than alive Elena. The Dark Lord has rebuilt me, given me a better purpose.
This is as it should be. You will also soon see the error of your ways.
So Vivica, any new pets I should be aware of?
Well there was a small problem with the Frost Owls...
But the soldiers carried to the very top of the fortress were almost completely unhurt while climbing back. It's all fine now!
Right. Somehow I don't think this is the last I hear of this...
It appears you're not falling back. That is most unwise.
The creatures and soldiers you've fought against have been nothing compared to what you shall face the further you go!
Elena, how are the troops holding up on the battlefield?
Amazingly well, all things considered. The fighting is hard, but our tactics have proven victorious when it matters.
Commander Grey. It is soon time for you to face your former friends. And crush them.
...your command is absolute. It shall be done.
Vivica! Why is there a tiny Dragon nesting atop that building?
Oh, the Owls really needed something to play with. Dragons are pretty much the only things that can survive that, though.
...right. Giant Owls and Dragons. What could go wrong...
The opposition is getting tougher, but we keep pushing on.
Don't forget to Train and Ascend your army. We don't know what's up ahead.
Elena, did the message arrive to the frontlines?
The message about the new tavern that we're about to open? It's going to be great!
Hah! Well that indeed is good news! I promise to spread the news!
The base seems quiet. Too quiet. Vivica, what's going on? Where are most of the people?
Hi Richard! Do you remember the Frost Owls and the tiny Dragon?
We're running low on supplies and we organized a hunting party that's using the Owls and the Dragon to find more food.
Wow, good thinking. So the creatures actually are of use. Impressive!
Grey! There must be something of your old self remaining. Something good!
...good and evil do not matter. Power matters. The Dark Lord shall prevail.
This is almost too much to bear... but if there's nothing left of the man you were, we will defeat the monster you've become!
Grey. You failed once at stopping the rebels. This is your chance...
...I will not fail this time. I will sacrifice all and become a vessel for dark power. My sole purpose is to destroy.
And our opponents will see what will be their monstrous fate.
We have progressed far from where we started at. The fate of the Empire will be decided soon.
The countless battles have hardened us into an army unlike any that these lands have ever seen.
Commander, you're defeated. I can see that whatever power kept you going is leaving you.
Cough... yes, the monster I was is soon gone for good. I can see now, in my final moments, clearly again...
Grey... know that we won't allow anyone to meet your fate again. The Dark Lord will pay for this!
Thank you... old friend. Farewell... may your sword... strike... true......
This is... unthinkable. Impossible. Your pitiful crusade should not have reached this far!
We have the will and might to do what no one has done before. We will destroy you.
No! What have you done?! I'm fading away! Aargh!!!
You're done for. Your dark power is leaving you.
We truly trashed you and your armies!
Maybe not, for darkness tends to find a new home no matter what. But this is the end for you.
Home at last. I think some celebrations are in order!
Yes! The tavern is loaded with finest food from around the Empire, and the representatives of the liberated nations are on their way.
That all sounds most appropriate. We have earned our rest.
Especially you Commander. Your tactics and will prevailed when the times were at their darkest.
Your dedication to rebuilding the fortress is what kept us motivated.
We all are in great debt to you. There will be new challenges ahead, but now we can celebrate our victory!
Elena, we meet again. It seems you've found new allies.
Yes, and together we'll end your evil rule on these lands!
That will never happen. You're not strong enough to reach my throne!
Hmm, is it just me or are there less rats nowadays in our fortress? It's so... tidy now.
While the army marches on we must all do our part in reclaiming the Empire. I captured and trained a couple of Frost Owls to hunt the vermin.
Uh... Frost Owls? Aren't they strong enough to carry a man? Are you sure they're tamed?
Absolutely sure! And they're cute as well!
Commander! I deliver this message to you, and only you.
When I defeated Elena last time, she was with the King.  I did not kill the King ‚Äì I merely offered him the chance to join my side.
If you continue on this path you also will be defeated. At that moment, if I'm merciful, I'll offer you the same choice. Join me or die.
Remember these words. Your cause is futile.
We're progressing well. The troops are on high morale.
Who wouldn't be? We're prevailing against the forces of the Dark Lord!
Well met Elena. You seem weary, is something wrong?
Thank you Vivica for the concern, but everything is as it should be. War should not be taken lightly, and the road ahead is long.
Very well. We here at base will do everything in our power to support the campaign!
Do you really think you have any hope to proceed further? Your tiny warband is insignificant when compared to my allies and minions across the Empire.
Our forces are growing, you fiend. Your days will be numbered!
The rebel army continues to march on... towards their doom.
Yes... they will fall before you, my lord. And then they will see that they must serve you.
We must find the sender of the mysterious message.
The shores of this island are full of monsters!
And they're wilder than the ones commanded by the Dark Lord...
Let's see if we can find someone to guide us in these strange new lands!
Look, a harbor town! We may find help there.
Hello there! You definitely do not look like you're from around here.
I'm a captain and I know these waters as well as the back of my hand.
I can help you find the sender of this message... for a price! What do you say?
Well, we do need the help. I wonder if she's trustworthy...
The message you got is curious indeed.
Where is this Atlantis mentioned in the message?
I know someone who might be able to help, though.
The man we are looking for can be hard to find.
Let us keep moving onward. I'm sure he'll be of help once he hears of our cause.
Someone has been watching us for a while from the jungle.
Yes. Instead of us finding him, the man we're looking for has found us.
Misandra! You lying sea-rat! I warned you not to approach my lands ever again!
Uh-oh. I think he's still angry at me. Lucky me that you're here to help in the battle, right?
Tarlak! Buddy! We're here just to talk!
You must leave now! I won't believe a word you're going to say.
Well, we did play a game of cards... which I happened to win.
He lost a family heirloom in that game. He did not take it lightly.
Hmm, this may turn out to be harder than we thought!
Tarlak, the man who was supposed to help us, is still angry.
I'm sorry about that. His people do not forgive easily.
Could we do something to show that we can be of help to his people?
I know what to do! Let's drive away the roaming monsters from these lands!
A show of force? Hmm, that might be something that Tarlak appreciates!
The swarms of monsters seem endless.
Let's push on. Tarlak must soon take notice of this.
You've crushed more monsters than I can count.
This is of help to my people. But why are you doing this?
Tarlak, I know you're angry at me. But these adventurers really need your help to find someone.
... Misandra, your offense against us is not easily forgotten. I must think about this.
Ouch. I think one of the monsters managed to bite me during the battle...
Hey, let me take a look at that.
This wound is poisoned... and the type of poison is unfamiliar to me.
Letting you die here would be dishonorable of me.
The only known cure is found further in the jungle. Follow me!
The poison is really taking its toll. I can barely walk.
I do not trust you yet. But I must do what I can to keep you alive.
A sacred waterfall is nearby. Its water heals those touched by the vile venom.
Misandra is in a really bad condition. Let's hurry!
We are at the sacred waterfall. Drink quickly!
I'm... not... sure... if... this... works...
She's fallen unconscious. But she was able to drink some of the water.
If she's strong, and if your intentions are honorable, she'll wake up healed.
Misandra has been sleeping for weeks.
It's hard to say if the poison is gone.
My healing magic does not work yet either.
I'm impressed of how dutifully you take care of Misandra.
Uh, I feel like I've slept for years...
You almost did! We're glad to have you back with us.
I guess I have misjudged you, Misandra. You and your companions have fought with honor.
Thank you Tarlak. It's good to be on talking terms again.
Gather your belongings and follow me. We have a long journey ahead.
This jungle is huge! I hope Tarlak knows where we are heading...
We're heading to a lost lagoon. It's not far from here.
I've heard that someone special has been seen in the lagoon.
We're almost at the lagoon. Get ready.
I appreciate that we're on the same side now, but are we sure there's something here?
Trust me. The eyes and ears of the jungle have never failed me.
We have no time to appreciate the scenery! Someone is approaching!
Well met, faraway travelers. I am Ariel, the Princess of Atlantis.
My plea for help has brought you here. It's time to tell you what this is all about.
Let me tell you why I have left my home. Let me tell you about the madness of my father, King Poseidon.
Thank you for making it this far. You clearly have the strength needed for what's ahead.
Indeed. Please allow me to continue my story.
I'm from the empire of Atlantis. My father, Poseidon, has maintained the peace there for centuries.
The peace was lost when Poseidon started a war with the surface world.
We'll continue later. I hope you know how to swim.
Our route will take us to the secret trails of Atlantis...
Cough cough! I've drank half the ocean during all the swimming!
I'm exhausted! My training in the mystical academy did not include underwater lessons!
You're all doing exceptionally fine for people of the land. Rest now - this is not the last time we must venture into the undersea realm.
Hey princess, trouble seems to follow you.
And that trouble could lead to real bad times around here!
Yes, this entire archipelago is in grave danger.
I find this all hard to believe... but the jungle has been filled with darkness as of late.
The darkness might be caused by Poseidon, my father!
I saw that something was wrong with him. The call to arms was against everything he believed in!
I fear that someone is controlling my father. I need your help to uncover the truth.
We're at the border of the Yama empire. They take great pride in their military might.
I have traded here many times. As long as I take care to follow their laws the business has been good.
Um, I don't see any signs of life here. Where are all the people?
If you would be so kind and surrender your weapons and valuables.
We're not surrendering anything! Prepare to fight!
You got that right, lady! We are here to save these lands from evil!
Brave, but foolish words! Master, we have found the Princess!
Ahh... the Princess of Atlantis. She's here. Excellent.
What is this? The lord of these lands has sworn to keep peace with the Atlanteans!
I'm the lord and the law here now! And you will not live to see another day!
Mitsuko! Why is the capture of the Princess taking so long!?
My lord! Her group is much stronger than expected.
Bah! It's your duty to defeat them, not to make excuses!
You put up a good fight, heroes. But sooner or later you'll make a mistake.
It's you who's making a mistake!
You and your boss are picking a fight with the wrong heroes!
The warlord is causing plenty of misery to the people living here.
But why is he after Ariel?
I'm wondering about that as well. Could Kageburado and my father somehow be in this together?
The farms here are pillaged. Is Kageburado after this as well?
I don't understand why one would ruin his own lands.
Kageburado does not appear to be the most sensible of warlords.
We need to hammer some sense into him!
Yet another village in ruins... no, wait! There's people still living here!
Yes, but I see soldiers on the horizon. They're about to attack the village!
We meet again, heroes. My commands are clear - destroy the village!
Despite my orders I welcome the chance to fight with you. There's little honor in capturing poor villagers!
Ha! We've bested you once again! And the village is safe!
Well fought! I have to withdraw and...
No-one withdraws today! Your incompetence is beyond comprehension, Mitsuko!
My lord! I did not mean...
Silence you fool! I clearly cannot trust you with my armies or power anymore.
Kageburado strikes Mitsuko down with his cursed sword!
No! This is... not... how... it was supposed... to end.
I'm wounded badly. Kageburado struck me with his cursed sword...
Dark powers are at play here.
Mitsuko... I must ask you this. Was Kageburado always like this?
No, something happened a while ago. There was a man from the ocean...
She's passed out. I fear she won't wake up soon.
While I find this hard to believe, it is clear that my father has something to do with the dark fate of this land.
We've come a long way through these lands already.
The warlord is not running out of soldiers, yet.
Whatever he sends at us, we will defeat.
Brave words, my friend. Let's see if they ring true!
Hey, something has been bothering me.
The dark power of Kageburado seems awfully similar to what the Dark Lord had.
Yes, they share similarities. But my mystical senses find no direct connection to the Dark Lord.
It seems odd that Poseidon would be the source of this dark power.
True. Atlantis is a powerful empire, but our powers come from the sea, not from darkness.
I suspect we must face the warlord soon to find the truth...
We've finally reached the capital city of the Yama empire!
You meddling fools! If you think you've accomplished anything, think again!
We've defeated hundreds, if not thousands, of your minions!
Actually, I don't see any supporters for you anywhere.
I'd say your reign is about to be over, buddy!
No! Never! This is not true!
The dark power... is leaving me...
That serves you right! This empire is free of you now!
He's done for. Now we can finally head to Atlantis!
... What is that noise coming from the harbor?
Kneel before the might of Atlantis, mortal heroes!
Father! Why are you doing this?
There is evil in the People of the Land!
We, the People of the Sea, must attack first to ensure our survival!
But that does not make any sense. We have had no dispute with these people!
Why do you fight along these unworthy heroes, my daughter?
Why do you resist what must be done?
These heroes have shown honor during my travels with them.
It is you who are horribly wrong, father! I beg of you to see past your rage!
We managed to hold our own against Poseidon.
He will attack again - the madness in his eyes is still burning hot!
Let's head away from the shore. It's too dangerous here.
So, does anyone have a good idea for how to battle the ruler of the seas?
Hmm. The Ancient Spirits of jungle sometimes see what us mortals cannot.
So we go look for ghosts?
Not ghosts. Spirits. And yes, we must look for them further inland.
Hey Tarlak, are you sure that these ghosts will speak to us? Or that they are friendly?
The Spirits have helped my tribe countless of times before.
There is no doubt of their help - as long as we can find them.
Right, I guess we're pretty far from your lands now.
Yes, we've come far. But I can feel the presence of the Spirits here as well.
These ancient ruins are full of mystical energy!
We're at the right place! I must call for the Spirits!
[#1e77ff]We are the Tribal Spirits. We've been following your quest.[#]
[#1e77ff]You seek to stop the Lord of the Seas? Very well...[#]
[#1e77ff]Poseidon is being manipulated by an evil force.[#]
[#1e77ff]A force that originates from the darkest depths directly below Atlantis![#]
What happened? Why is everyone staring at me?
Good. What did we learn from them?
Poseidon is manipulated by something below Atlantis!
But this one is truly horrible if it can control my father!
To save my father we must go to the throne room of Atlantis!
It has a secret gateway to the forbidden depths.
Whatever is the cause of my father's madness resides there!
So the plan is to charge through the armies of Poseidon, and then smash whatever we find in the throne room?
That's a plan I can agree with!
Our adventures in these islands have taken us to many places.
Yes, I wasn't expecting the tour to be so extensive. Or dangerous...
The monsters here put up a good fight!
And I think there is still more to see...
We're getting closer to the city of Atlantis.
I assume we're not going to get in peacefully?
No, we're not going to get there without a fight. My father will make sure of that!
You, the People of the Land, seek to enter Atlantis?
This will not happen. I will crush you, and then you will pose no more danger to my realm!
Father! I know you're being controlled! We must go through here to save you and our realm!
I must stop anyone who tries to approach the throne room. Even if it's my own daughter!
I'm... defeated. I must stop anyone... from proceeding...
I don't think he's quite right in his mind yet!
How pitiful the mighty Poseidon now seems! Defeated by a puny band of traveling heroes!
Who are you? What have you done to my father?
Enter my realm, sweet princess, to find out the truth. Ha ha ha!
We're now entering my home city. Or what's left of it.
Yeah, this place seems awfully creepy and full of monsters. Not my kind of home, to be honest.
The thing we met outside the city is behind all of this.
It has filled the halls of Atlantis with horror and danger!
Welcome to the Empire of Dark Depths!
By the Ancestors! What are you?
Ha ha ha! Poseidon had me locked away for centuries.
I'm Ursena, Empress of the Depths and the true ruler of the seas!
Ursena is toying with us, sending the corrupted Atlantean forces to slow us down.
Ursena reeks of evil and malice.
You got that right, big boy. She's a real rotten fish!
I don't think Ursena is yet at her full power.
I've read about her in the old storybooks, and in the stories she had almost limitless power.
We're at a disadvantage here. Fighting underwater is dangerous business for us!
We're nearly at the throne room!
Oh, you've made it this far. I thought you'd have perished already.
That doesn't matter. Very soon I will be strong enough to take over the world!
We'll see about that, you slimy hag!
You've tainted our islands long enough. You will be stopped today!
What is this!? How can you stop me, the empress of the Depths!
That's right lady, this is the end of your evil plans!
She's falling back into the depths!
Thank you, my child! Her dark power is no longer tainting my thoughts.
Yes, I'm finally myself again. Thank you all, brave heroes.
It was a honor to be able to help, Lord of the Seas.
Yeah, it's pretty rare to get to be a part of such an adventure.
And to think it all started with a message in a bottle!
Who would have thought it leads to such a grand quest?
Once more I thank you heroes. Both Atlantis and the archipelago are saved thanks to your courage!
Portal travel always makes me dizzy!
That was unlike any portal I've ever traveled through. Raw. Primal.
I'm more concerned about this place. Where are we? And is this place a threat to our home?
Well, this place is definitely the source of the tremors we felt earlier.
I can feel enemies approaching... Touched by a dark power I've never encountered.
Who are you? And what is this place?
I am Agnes and this is my brother Bjorn.
Welcome to Midgard. It was my portal that brought you here.
You really came from another world through that portal?!
About the portal: I have some feedback...
You're hearing colors and everything is spinning? It will pass in a few minutes.
You are here because a shadowy threat extends now across all worlds, including your own.
The universe grows out-of-balance. You are a user of magic, yes? You must have felt it.
Please travel with us. We will explain more as we go.
Agnes and Bjorn, you spoke of a threat?
Talking about threats and dangers is kind of her thing. She's very good at it.
I am the daughter of a Seer. The gods honor me with visions.
And what have you seen of late?
Of late? Nothing. The gods are silent.
You don't know the half of it, fools!
Blast. We lost him. Who was that?
An-Windr. A servant to a dark power.
This "An-Windr" held command over our foes.
Yes. He appears to have been given some authority.
Ymir, the King of Ice Giants in Jotunheim has seemingly promoted him.
King of Ice Giants! That's a cool title!
He is not cool. Nor is An-Windr's promotion. It means the dark powers have become courageous.
That's why the gods have fallen silent.
Then we must find the gods. And hear what they have to say for themselves.
It is no easy thing winning an audience with the gods. But...
Ha! You'll like what she's going to say next.
I know a place where we can meet someone who was once a god.
Agnes has always wanted to meet a god.
You should read the scholarly love ballads Agnes has written.
He often dwells near this morass...
"Once?" Really. When it comes to godhood there is no past tense.
Psst, Bjorn. Who is this weird guy?
Loki. Trickster. Adopted son of Odin the All-Father. Exiled for the slaying of Odin's favored son, Baldur.
Now that the gods are silent, they do not have the power to hold me in exile. So, sweethearts, if you'll excuse me...
Wait! Tell us: why are the gods silent? And what is this dark power that spreads across the Nine Realms?
Hmm... well. You definitely haven't proven yourselves worthy of that information.
Meet me in Vanaheim. If you survive that far, we can talk.
I'd like to learn that trick!
A small, furry creature suddenly jumps from the bushes.
Meet Ratatoskr, messenger of the gods. Ratatoskr, I thought you'd be as silent as your masters!
An-Windr has rallied an army! The army marches from Vanaheim! Alarm! Alarm! Midgard will fall!
Not while I have a say in it. To arms!
Agnes! Rally your fellow Midgardians! We will see this army off, and An-Windr with it!
All right, Bjorn! Let's crack some monster skulls!
Great idea! Let's also break some bones!
That's the last of the monsters. Agnes, how are your allies from Midgard?
It takes more than the likes of An-Windr and his minions to keep us down.
They came from that direction. Beyond those mountains.
Yes. That's Vanaheim. If I were a betting man, and I am, I would say An-Windr has conquered it.
Loki offered to meet us there... But that's enemy territory.
Our only choice is to go on. Even now I feel the Nine Realms trembling beneath our feet.
We must find out what is going on here! It threatens our world as well!
It is true. Even I can feel it. Something is very, very wrong.
To Vanaheim, then. To find Loki and answers.
Yes, this is the realm of the Vanir. They are the masters of sorcery and prophecy.
... this place is alive with magic. Magic has shaped everything in it. I... I have never seen anything so beautiful.
Wait until you visit Alfheim. The elves really know how to landscape.
Be on your guard! An-Windr knows we are coming.
Then we have two goals here in Vanaheim...
Defeat An-Windr, and find out what Loki knows.
Loki will not appear until he has had his fun.
He'll have fun watching us fight for our lives, no doubt...
Then let's give him a good show!
It seems An-Windr is not here.
If I was An-Windr I'd want a vantage point. Someplace with a view, to watch us.
There. That is the old Vanir aerie. That's where I learned the ways of the Seer.
Oh my. I can still hear their songs, from long ago...
The magic is strong here. Tell me, sorceress: what else do you hear?
Soon, my King. Soon your new world shall be born!
You talk too much, servant. Intruders are approaching.
Today, Vanaheim. Tomorrow... worlds beyond number. MINIONS! ATTACK!
Oh no! I can see that they are attacking!
Oh YES! More monsters to smack!
This is the aerie, place of ancient learning. But it has been befouled by An-Windr...
Agnes, I think it can be cleansed. This is but a brief indignity.
Loki appears out of thin air... again.
Yes, the Vanir are quite adept at working miracles. Unless, of course, someone is interrupting their work.
Someone who's a complete moron. Someone like An-Windr.
Loki. We have played your game. Now tell us: what is happening?
Why are the Nine Realms trembling, and our home along with them?
Oh, I think An-Windr could tell you all that better than I ever could.
If he says An-Windr has the answers, then it's An-Windr we must find.
In my vision, I heard An-Windr speaking with his master, Ymir, the King of Ice Giants.
Let's push on. An-Windr can't be far anymore!
Ha! The universe trembles beneath me, the mighty An-Windr, and you dare to challenge me?
It is not he who makes the worlds tremble! It is his master who holds the power.
Tell us: what darkness has Ymir unleashed?
Better you see it for yourselves. Yes.
My king demands your deaths... I shall string you all from the World Tree.
You will witness the glorious horror my King is creating. He shall hear your screams, and be pleased with me.
Do we have to keep listening to this?
He was a boring conversationalist anyway.
An-Windr wasn't going to tell us anything useful. We are counting on you, Loki.
Little old me? How could I possibly help mighty heroes such as you...?
Enough games! What is Ymir up to and how do we stop him?
Oh please... the King of Ice Giants doesn't have the mental might to plan something like this.
Do you mean Ymir is working with... other gods?
How can we stop a god? Let alone more than one?
Do you know why I was placed in exile?
Please, she knows all the stories about you.
Accidentally, not that anyone believes me. His name was Baldur, and he was Odin's favorite son.
And he was my step-brother, for the record. Me being adopted and all that.
We do not have time for this!
I think you do, sweetheart. If only you were smart enough to understand what I'm telling you.
And I'm only half a god, really. Demigod, at best.
Gods can be killed, sweetness. By regular, run-of-the-mill boring little people like yourselves.
Are you saying that we should kill the gods that are behind this all? Is that enough to stop their plans?
I'm afraid you have only one way of finding out. Good luck!
Right. First things first. Do you know what "Jotunheim" means, friends?
It is ruled over by the Ymir, the King of Ice Giants. Which is why this place is colder than Agnes' sense of humor.
We have been moving toward a great source of power.
Yes. We are very close now.
Clearly Ymir does not wish to be disturbed.
Agh... A small tremor? I can sense something in pain.
Something cries out for aid. Something... massive.
This may be worse than I had feared. We must hurry.
Vivica. You felt a great pain. From where did it come?
Then that is where we must go.
They're beginning to put up a stronger fight.
There is most certainly something here that they do not wish us to find.
Agh! Did... did you feel that?
Another tremor. Bigger than the others.
Agnes. What aren't you telling us?
Forgive me. I am not being deceptive. Rather...
The messenger of gods does not seem to be delivering good news.
Ratatoskr. I fear I know what you have come to tell us.
Ymir! He brings death to life as his wife seeks to bring life to death!
I didn't understand any of that.
Has Ymir succeeded in his plans?
Close! He is very close to succeeding!
Agnes... What aren't you telling us?
There's no time for that. Follow me! We may already be too late.
I feel the life draining... fleeing... from this realm.
And those damned tremors. The ground itself is fit to burst.
It is enough for you to know that the King of Ice Giants seeks to unmoor the Nine Realms.
To set our lands adrift from one another, to sail forever into the void, becoming nothing.
Him doing so will bring about an ending to the universe as you know it.
Including our own world and home.
The old man bids you to hurry! The tree is dying!
The tree in whose arms we all rest. The tree in whom I make my home.
The tree whose trunk I run down to tell you: Yggdrasil is dying!
The old man refers to Odin, the All-Father. God of Gods. Father to Thor, Step-father to Loki.
Ruler of the Nine Realms, from his seat in Asgard. From which Yggdrasil, the World Tree, spreads her roots.
Roots which bind the Nine Realms together.
But why would Ymir want to destroy the very land upon which they live?
The tremors are increasing. We can talk more later.
Too slow! You are too slow!
Hurry. While there is still time.
Come, Bjorn. As the stranger says.
Is that the King of Ice Giants?
Indeed, husband. These are the heroes that have hacked their way through dying lands...
We come to save the World Tree, giant!
And if that means we have to carve our way through your legions...
What have you done? Where is my husband?!
Your husband lies defeated. And his work is undone.
Or was the work completed days before your arrival?
Agnes, look! What is that enormous, twisted wall of wood?
That is one of the World Tree's roots. Now shrivelled and black.
So the tree lost one root. A tree has many roots. The tree is fine and we have saved the day!
Oh, insects. To destroy a universe is more than the work of one man, woman or god.
I shall continue my husband's work...
She means to bring about the death of the universe?
Yes. Our stories speak of this...
This is Svartalfheim. Be wary. We have no need to linger here...
We only need to pass through.
This is the realm of Alfrike.
She is the Queen of the Dark Elves... And we just killed her husband.
We're surrounded by black thicket. This realm is like a maze.
You took Ymir from me. Now I will take something from you.
I will take all that you have.
Alfrike is determined to see us undone.
This is her territory. It's her dominion....
... and she is driven by the fury of grief.
We have but one purpose in this place: to get through it.
We must go to Helheim, the Land of the Dead. It's the realm of the goddess Hel.
I would have preferred a god of parties, but the goddess of death was the only one available.
We must learn why the gods have fallen silent.
Best to ask one, then. Let's keep moving.
The realm of the Dark Elves was not always this dark.
This was before Alfrike fell in love with the King of Ice Giants.
Lore tells us they were both good, once, but that their individual natures poisoned each other.
Turning them into something twisted. Gone was Good Queen Alfrike.
Then came the rise of the Dark Elves.
It is her very nature that has made this place what it is.
It is a reflection of her mind.
No. It is a reflection of her soul.
Terror will come upon your worlds. It shall be a fitting memorial for the King you laid low.
And all the Realms of all the Worlds shall drift, alone, forever...
... and Asgard, at last, shall be as it was meant to be.
A land for the gods. And none other.
Before long they shall be upon us, wide of eye and bloody of tooth.
This is her Realm, and she would hurl it all into the Void to stop us.
I feel that Alfrike and Ymir did not plan this alone.
Fight on, my people! Fight on, fierce Dark Elves!
I must leave to call upon our ally!
Correct me if I'm wrong, but Alfrike is headed the same way we are.
The Queen of the Dead is Alfrike's ally?
Let's move as quickly as we can. So that we can ask Hel directly.
We must get to the Realm of the Dead before Alfrike.
It is hard to believe that Hel would ally with Alfrike. Alfrike is a source of chaos!
Is Hel not the Queen of Death?
Death, yes, as a part of the cycle of rebirth. An agent of oblivion and chaos she is not.
Oblivion, chaos, death... All sounds bad to me!
Things might not be as simple as they seem... Onward!
Agnes, you say we must pass through Niflheim to reach Helheim?
Yes. Niflheim is a freezing realm, full of mist and dark magic. It has been a second home to Alfrike and Ymir.
You mentioned that they were planning Ragnarok?
Ragnarok... We were frightened as children with tales of Ragnarok...
... That it may happen now, should we fail, is beyond imagination.
Failing is not an option. Let's go!
Fenrir, Leader of Niflheim, your Queen asks for your aid.
Alfrike... the whole of Niflheim shares your grief. The King was...
I have no use for your grief, wolf-lord. I require your fealty, and your forces.
You have that and more. You know this, Alfrike.
Those who defeated your King will soon be here. Stopping them would bring you great honor.
I shall revel in their demise.
As you please. I have business in Helheim and must depart soon.
And I shall gift you their heads. To keep you company on your long journey.
The battle goes well. The intruders are a most invigorating opponent.
Do not toy with them, wolf-lord. They are not an easy prey.
Fear not. We are almost done with them. Go now. They shall bother you no more.
I thank you, dear wolf. As would your King. Farewell.
I cared not for the King. Only you.
How many more of them are there?!
Far more than I can count!
If we do not break through...
We don't want her to meet Hel before us!
In the name of Queen Alfrike! Attack!
Make the outsiders regret marching to Niflheim!
Fenrir! Listen! Alfrike means to unmoor the worlds we all share!
Had I to choose between the universe and Alfrike...
She is without a husband. But not for long.
I shall prove I am twice the warrior Ymir ever was.
I beg audience, Queen of the Dead. Your realm faces annihilation.
I know who you are, Queen of Svartalfheim. I know very well.
The World Tree which binds our realms together, keeps us moored amid the chaos of unending Void...
Her roots, Hel. The roots of the World Tree have been attacked. Poisoned. By outsiders.
In Jotunheim. In Svartalfheim. And now they come for Helheim.
Come closer. Tell me of these... outsiders.
As we speak Niflheim trembles. Brave Fenrir leads the defense.
You shall remain here as my guest. Until the truth of this is revealed.
My legions shall assist Fenrir in defense of Niflheim.
If it is as you say, my army of the dead shall not rest until these intruders are gone.
Someone has been listening in the shadows...
Oh. Alfrike's good. She's very, very good with lies and deception...
The battle goes poorly, but if defeat is my destiny I meet it gladly...
... knowing I have done her will.
Yes... I know you, Queen of the Dead!
Have you come to aid my army, or add them to your own?
Alfrike told me the tale of Ragnarok. Do you know it?
The tale of Ragnarok... I do.
It is a tale all shall know before long, and the final one should we fail here.
In that case, I come as a friend.
Meanwhile Alfrike is searching for something in Helheim...
Where is it? Where does the cold-blooded witch keep it? Where?!
Loki is still hiding in the shadows observing Alfrike...
What can she be looking for?
Something important enough that she tricked the Queen of Death into leaving Helheim unattended...
It is far, far more beautiful - and terrible - than I imagined.
Oh, Alfrike shouldn't have found that. This is bad.
The Runestone of Death! Said to give Hel her powers.
With this Runestone she rules over all the dead within the Nine Realms.
Fall back, my Legions! We shall regroup and once more press the attack.
What is this? The Legions of the Dead are not following my orders anymore?!
What?! The Legions of the Dead are not listening to their god?
Loki. Have you stolen Hel's power over her forces? Was this all part of some cunning game?
Well, I can't take credit for this.
Actually I'm here to tell you who HAS stolen Hel's power over her forces.
Alfrike. She stole the Runestone of Death.
Maybe that's what Loki wanted to do but Alfrike got to the Runestone first?
A puny trickster like Loki couldn't have even thought of that!
This plan was possible thanks to Alfrike's sovereign intelligence.
Alfrike is now the Queen of the Dead!
Dead Legions! Attack! For Queen Alfrike!
I may fall... but I will rise again...
Outsiders! Fenrir has been defeated but the Legion of the Dead is still under Alfrike's command!
That means trouble for all of the Nine Realms.
And there is more bad news.
The King of Fire Giants, Surtur. He has entered my lands during my absence.
I can feel it. He marches for the Yggdrasil Root in Helheim...
Surtur has joined forces with Alfrike. If Ymir was bad, Surtur is even worse.
Queen Hel, you have always treated our dead well.
It is our duty to retrieve the Runestone of Death for you, Queen Hel.
We must stop Ragnarok. Which means need to go to Helheim.
I can open Helvegr, the Road to Helheim, for you.
Your journey to the Realm of the Dead shall be quick.
For the sake of the Nine Realms, stop Surtur and save the Root of Yggdrasil!
So. This is the Land of the Dead.
No... skulls. I was expecting more skulls.
It moves! It moves against her age-old enemies!
Alfheim is a realm of artistry. Of peace.
This sounds like trouble for the elves.
Far. Beyond Muspelheim, the realm of the Fire Giants.
The very name "Muspelheim" means "the end of the world through fire."
We can't possibly make it in time to be of any aid to Alfheim.
A woman with golden hair approaches the heroes...
Hello Sif. Sif, this is everyone. Everyone, Sif.
We are the only hope Alfheim has, and there are realms of death and fire between us and them.
By the way Loki, Thor says hello.
So, tell me brother-in-law, how is it you were in Hel's chambers when Alfrike stole the Runestone of Death?
That was quite a stroke of... luck.
It was luck! You were lucky good old Loki was there to witness it! To tell you of Alfrike's betrayal!
The talking rat brought the news, not you, you two-faced lord of lies.
If you were in Hel's chambers out of any sort of duty, it was duty only to yourself, Loki. As ever.
Of course! You were there to steal the Runestone for yourself!
What? Well... I never. After all I've done for you.
All right, fine. Yes. I was there to steal the Runestone. But not for the reason you think.
I did not kill my brother, Baldur. I did not deserve to be cast from the sight of Father's one remaining eye.
But there's only one person who can prove it.
You... you were going to bring Baldur back?
Odin may not believe me, the supposed "murderer"...
But he would have to believe the murdered!
Your Eternal Darkness. How may this humble servant please you?
I'm bringing the Runestone of Death with utmost haste, oh Great Devourer.
My agonizing of the Elves is also a gift, oh Looming Shadow.
This is an opportunity that we should not waste.
Burn the Elves. For your service I shall be grateful.
Then fly to me, with all haste..
Otherwise... you will suffer more than the Elves.
Y-yes, oh Devouring Oblivion. In all things I am your instrument.
Alfrike! Alfrike is to gift the Runestone of Death to...!
A voice she called... the Devouring Oblivion.
The power of life and death must not fall into the hands of the unworthy.
But we must also guard the Root of Yggdrasil here in Helheim.
We must protect the Root from the King of Fire Giants...
My husband, Thor, already takes the battle to Muspelheim.
The sooner we can meet him there, the better.
There! The great Helheim Root of the Yggdrasil, the World Tree! And...
No! The root is under attack!
Ho. Ho. Ho. Do your work, my army of the dead. Yes. Cut away the life of the root.
We're too late. The root is nearly severed. I feel my connection... to my Realm... dying...
Ho ho ho.  Behold, legions. Some light exercise.
Fight on, my dead soldiers! In Muspelheim shall we rejoin!
The Helheim Root! The army of the dead did not manage to completely sever it.
But the King of Fire Giants will not stop. He still has the Runestone and most of his army...
Through his stolen army... and beyond...
All right, listen, you both need to remain calm!
I am NOT well! I am BURNING with RAGE!
YOU would DARE to steal the power of LIFE AND DEATH from HEL HERSELF?!
Ragnarok's approach may have shattered the wards of your exile...
... you may have escaped a Kinslayer's fate with Odin's kindly sentence...
... but for this outrage you will face our All-Father a second time.
That you have escaped? Yes. He... commands an audience with you.
Of course. For the best, I expect.
I... should find Thor. Before he punches a hole through something we need.
Of course. Thank you for ensuring that I wasn't the one to get punched.
I will not rest until this wrong is made right.
Hel is weakened. Her spirit is tied to Helheim, and Helheim is tied to its damaged Root.
And Surtur, the King of Fire Giants, intends to destroy the rest of the Roots. And somehow you're involved, I have no doubt.
Agnes. How quickly can we make it to Surtur's fortress?
If we are swift and Odin favors us we may reach him before he makes his next move.
We are to save the Nine Realms, and Asgard itself. We must persevere. We take the fight to them!
Then we have talked enough. Draw steel and move.
Pace yourselves. The heat in Muspelheim favors the King of Fire Giants and his godly ilk...
... but for mortal folk such as us it is a furnace. And the King of Fire Giants rests deep in its belly.
While Alfrike makes haste toward Alfheim, our heroes are taking a short rest in Muspelheim...
When you were sneaking in Helheim, did you also mean to steal my power, Loki?
Well, I did plan to borrow it.
Because you wished an audience with your slain brother, Baldur?
Why not simply request it of me?
Exile tends to make these things difficult.
And my reputation, well, that tends to end conversations before they begin.
"Loki Kinslayer." Yes. I imagine it does.
You say you did not kill your brother, Baldur?
Quite a story. And quite an error on Odin's part, if true.
You know what they say: "You can't choose family."
Loki! The day is ended. We need another for dice and cards. Will you join us?
Why not, provided there's some coin involved.
Unjustly exiled? Perhaps, Kinslayer. Perhaps not.
I observe... everything. Surtur is about to make his move.
Nothing - no Thunder God, no otherworldly heroes - shall save those who try to interfere...
Unhhh... I'm sensing a great evil watching us...
It knows that we are here....
"A terrible darkness. With a voice like thunder." That is what Ratatoskr said.
This must be the big bad monster that's causing all the trouble!
In my name... erase the very memory of these heroes. These... so-called gods.
Legions of Fire and Death! Strike!
I... I am fine. I can still fight. I will still fight.
You know this better than anyone, Once-Queen of the Dead.
The thing you cannot smite. Cannot fight. That to whom final triumph has always been assured.
I am afraid Nidhogg is anything but gone.
Nidhogg soars past Muspelheim and heads towards the twisting cosmos in the middle of the eight Realms...
We live... to fight another day.
You are warriors worthy of Asgard.
You have the God of Thunder among you. Today we have begun to turn back the tide!
Alfheim! Alfheim! The Realm of the Elves is besieged!
The army of the dead... I feel their empty eyes upon that green land...
Alfrike's army of the dead... the Elves are not ready to face them.
The Elves will be crushed. We must aid them.
Agnes... Bjorn... Hel is weak. Without her the Runestone of Death has no proper owner.
If we are to stop the army of the dead, we must stay strong.
We have to act swiftly for a chance to defeat the King of Fire Giants.
For once my brother and I are in agreement.
Then we do not rest. We raise sword and shield and rally against the enemy. No matter the cost.
Remarkable... For once my brother and I are indeed in agreement. You are warriors worthy of Asgard.
Come. We have an appointment with the King of Fire Giants.
The ninth Realm of the Nine Realms, Asgard, has now appeared in the middle of the other Realms.
Well well well. The heroes return, and so quickly.
They have, at last, fathomed the full nature of their predicament.
But too late. Nidhogg has returned to the Nine Realms, and Alfrike is about to burn Alfheim...
Let desperation drive you into your doom!
The King of Fire Giants... has fallen.
I trust... he did not fall in vain...
No, my Lord. He bought us valuable time.
Alfheim is in flames! A weapon. Give me a weapon.
Sif, do not let this wretch claim the enchanted weapons.
Good Queen Hel, this toad slew my brother, Baldur. He will...
Thunder God, the late Baldur now resides with me in the Lands of the Dead.
And I tell you, here and now:
Allow Loki to claim the golden sword.
I trust Hel in this matter. Here's your sword, Loki.
You save Alfheim. I intend to point this sword at a certain Queen of Svartalfheim.
Alfrike has not fled. She is close. I can smell her.
Alfrike is not yet finished with this once-happy realm.
All of a sudden Alfrike appears in front of the heroes!
And here the heroes are attempting to catch me... How touching!
Speak, Alfrike. Say what you must and begone.
Your half-brother Baldur was brighter than you, Trickster.
Baldur learned of Nidhogg, yes. And so... Nidhogg killed Baldur.
And your family blamed you, poor Loki, for the death of your half-brother.
Still laughing, Alfrike vanishes as swiftly as she had appeared.
Hel knew the truth, for Baldur now resides with her in the Realm of the Dead.
To jump on us like that, Alfrike seems to be keeping very close to us, yes?
You're asking me if I understand why you said nothing when it could have repaired the rift in my family?
Even though it would have restored me in my father Odin's eye? I do.
If the boundary between life and death is not respected, life ceases to be of value.
And the universe along with it.
You are the most majestic Queen after all, oh Queen of the Dead.
I fear Alfrike will soon give Nidhogg what he wants most... the Runestone of Death.
That means... Nidhogg will become Overlord of the Dead.
And the boundaries between life and death will fall.
Death will become life. Life will be death.
You're a bit late on this one, Ratatoskr.
The dead of Alfheim! THEY RISE!
Alfrike was almost too strong for us...
And so the border between life and death thins.
Even as Yggdrasil, the World Tree herself, dies.
I must have the Runestone. Without it I cannot bring the dead to rest.
This is just a taste of Nidhogg's grand design.
We must stop Alfrike. The Runestone of Death must never be delivered to Nidhogg.
That is Alfrike's camp. The scouts are certain of it.
Then I will strike asunder their forces, with the mighty thunder of my hammer!
... we go in quietly and capture the Runestone before she knows we're even there.
Unless she already knows we're here.
I fly to you, oh Crushing Despair, oh Obsidian Night. The Runestone shall be yours!
The heroes now realize that they might be too late!
Comrades! Are you hearing what I'm hearing?
Alfheim raises alarms to the west and east. Look!
We're being flanked left and right.
But where's Alfrike? Is she fleeing again?
Draw steel! We must catch her!
The Runestone! Where is the Runestone?!
Alfrike... you have failed to stop my enemies...
But you succeeded... in delivering that which I desire...
Now the Runestone of Death is mine!
Too late. We are too late.
Now ... my gaze is on Asgard.
There! A majestic city next to a giant tree. Asgard!
Nidhogg sends his regards, Queen of the Dead...
... and wishes you a swift and painful journey home!
The fell wolf is not alone! Stand fast!
He got his power back thanks to Nidhogg.
This is wrong. Only a god may raise a god from the dead.
The halls of the dead... are vast. And full.
The towering walls of Asgard draw near.
Asgard and the tree Yggdrasil! They're under siege!
We're nearly at Asgard. Where is Odin?
He's defending the Hall of Valkyries, I expect. At the center of the city.
Nidhogg is summoning another fallen god to his aid.
The King of Fire Giants. From the halls of Helheim you are summoned...
Yes. And my minions are with me.
By the burning firepits of Muspelheim! I'm done for. Again...
Enough of that hothead! We move on!
I wonder if Nidhogg has more tricks awaiting us...
It's cold all of a sudden. Too cold.
Even from death we ride to your aid, Nidhogg.
The King of Ice Giants! You shall fall again, as did your brother!
Yes, meddlers. I shall fight alongside my husband!
Odin's beard! Fighting two gods at once is a nightmare!
Listen, everyone: keep them busy. I have an idea.
You shall not stop the plans of the great Nidhogg!
Our faith in you, Nidhogg, sustains us both! Ymir, my love... let's...
Alfrike and Ymir could not stop us... Their anger and fury was fearsome, but we prevailed.
And now Helheim, the Realm of the Dead, calls them back.
Valhalla is ahead! Nidhogg must already be waiting for us there.
You must keep Nidhogg distracted. Push his forces back!
If I sneak past this battlefield, I can get the one thing we now need...

Before the others even notice that Loki has disappeared, he returns.

The Trickster still looks concerned.
The World Tree is dying. The Nine Realms are drifting apart. Is the world already beyond repair...?
Not to worry. I, Odin the All-Father, will undo Nidhogg's poison!
Oh, Odin! The god of gods!
Odin, father. To repair what Nidhogg has broken you need the Runestone of Death.
The Runestone that I, Loki the Trickster, conveniently managed to steal just a moment ago!
My wayward son ... well done. The Great Devourer, Nidhogg, shall have his plans undone!
With this Runestone I call you, The World Tree. I call you,  Binder of the Nine Realms.
With all that I am ... with the power of the Runestone...

A bright light fills the air as Odin calls for the power of the Runestone.

In hands of Odin, the Runestone of Death is also the Runestone of Life.
Look at the Tree. It is strong and green once more!
AARRG ... this will not do! Not at all!
If poison fails... If plotting and planning lead nowhere...
... then the only course of action left is to BURN EVERYTHING!

Nidhogg calls for terrible powers beyond mortal understanding.

The summoning roar echoes in the halls of the dead once more as Nidhogg grows in power!
By my beard! That was a rumble that was felt across all Nine Realms!
You have proved yourselves worthy of Valhalla!
I'm glad we were of help against the devious dragon!
It's great to see the majestic Yggdrasil well again.
The World Tree lives. Nidhogg is vanquished. Balance returns.
But we... We should probably return to our own world.
You leave a grateful Asgard, wanderers.
We shall be here to protect the Nine Realms.
The Nine Realms are in good hands!
And we know the end of this adventure shall be the start of a next one!
We're always ready for new adventure.
Should you have need for our assistance.
New adventures ahead! We await your alarm!
Welcome. I am Phileas Fogg. My friend Passepartout speaks highly of you.
And I am Aouda, Phileas' wife and partner in this fantastical expedition.
Allow me to introduce the esteemed scientist Doctor Moreau.
You really do find the most interesting... specimens... Fogg.
And this is Moreau's erstwhile assistant, Elizabeth.
But first we need to find our Captain, who's also our guide.
He departed to scout the entrance some time ago and has not returned.
Then we had best find him. Lead on.
Blast. Our Captain's tricorn hat. He would never abandon it willingly.
Friends, it was the Captain who discovered the entrance to the Underwild, he who has met and befriended its many peoples...
Peoples I am most... anxious... to meet.
And the Captain learned their languages and customs. I fear without him our expedition is over before it begins.
Mister Fogg! I believe he was taken this way! I see many tracks!
Oh Moreau. I cannot wait to learn everything about this place...
Mister Fogg, who is this Captain? You seem to think quite highly of him.
A fine man of singular eccentricities.
Phileas is being diplomatic. Our Captain is... eccentric.
And the Captain has many, many stories to tell.
I thought the stories were fantasy at first, but one cannot deny that this entrance to another world is very real.
It shall be our greatest adventure, Mister Fogg! The world underneath our world!
These underworld beings fight with a natural-born ferocity. Fascinating...
Hello! Ah, you have my hat. Excellent.
Fogg. Right on time. I was just negotiating with the locals as per our passage.
The way into the Underwild. It is clear?
Indeed it is, good Passepartout. Though... our journey may not be a smooth one.
"Not a smooth journey," you said, Nemo.
Have your dealings with the locals not gone well?
I believe I can answer that.
Richard points at the bunch of hostile eyes glaring from the shadows.
Those stalactites. They're massive. They must have taken aeons to form!
The scents are getting stronger... I can smell the primordial jungle even from here!
Before we have any hope of seeing the jungle, sweet Aouda, we must first survive these caves that join here to there.
Then let us waste no more time.
We have taken our first steps on a journey to another world, my friends!
Hold friends! We approach the lands of the Eloi: a kind and gentle people.
It is I, my friends! Returned to you once more!
I... I assure you... that was all... a misunderstanding.
Surely they're not still upset about the "incident."
Oh look. They're attacking again. Fascinating.
Gentle as they may be it appears the Eloi can hold a grudge.
After many adventures the Eloi honored me with... a prestigious gift. So of course they gave me a great symbol of power: a set of musical Pipes.
The Eloi and the vicious Morlocks have been warring for generations. I sought to negotiate peace...
I may have given the Morlocks the Pipes. As a token of good faith.
The Eloi are attacking yet again! Marvelous!
You gave the Morlocks the Pipes. And now they are sweeping the Eloi before them.
They robbed me, actually, if I'm to be entirely honest. Barely escaped with my hat.
So... the Pipes are meant for more than music...
I can set this right. It was never my intention to endanger the realms of the Underwild.
We must get those Pipes back from the Morlock chieftain.
Neither side of this conflict will trust you, Nemo, and with good reason.
Chance will deliver us the opportunity to change that, Fogg. I have the utmost confidence.
Monsieur Fogg! Madame Aouda! The creatures! They are attacking the Eloi camp!
Yes. I suppose if we aid the Eloi in this moment of need they may provide you a chance to clear your name.
Elizabeth, did you see the manner in which the creatures behaved?
Yes. Coordinated. Strategic. Almost as if...
Eloi! Nemo, the mighty adventurer has returned to you in your time of need! Please keep your praise to a low roar. I have sensitive ears.
Nemo! You did this!! The Emerald Pipes have driven the creatures mad!
It did not look like madness to me, Moreau...
Indeed they appear to have only retreated in order to sweep around and catch us from both sides.
They are back! We are under attack!
Excuse me. Did the Eloi say "Emerald Pipes"?
Yes! Nemo the Betrayer gave the Pipes to our enemy! The sound of the pipes turns the creatures against us!
These Pipes, do they make a high, reedy sort of tune?
Yes. They are Pipes. You're not the brains of the outfit, are you?
The Pipes! The Morlock chieftain attacks again!
Fogg. Might I suggest we follow that delightful music?
Indeed, following the music would undeniably lead us to the Pipes.
And with them a resolution to Nemo's debacle - and an eventual peace.
Oh, Moreau... it's all coming together.
The pipes seem to have a hypnotizing effect over our foes.
Oh that's the least of it. If those truly are the Emerald Pipes...
... then they do more than hypnotize the living. They reassemble life itself.
The caves above. The light is getting stronger there.
Cover your ears! Pay the music no heed!
I sense movement in the tunnels around us...
We're close to the Morlocks. We have to get into their stronghold.
Success! We have breached the Darkwind Stronghold.
The Morlocks... they have really improved the place.
When last I was here the Morlocks were little more than warring tribes, but this...!
This is more organized. More advanced.
The Pipes, Moreau. The Emerald Pipes did this.
Let us stay quiet about this. For now.
These Morlocks are far more formidable than you first described, Nemo.
Strange that we should make it this far into their territory.
We do so because they permit it. Do you not feel it?
I feel like we're being watched.
Sacre bleu! Moreau! Miss Elizabeth! They are gone!
Nemo! We must rescue them, poste haste!
Rescue them? From the horde of Morlocks? Did you not witness their numbers, Fogg?
We'll get them back, Phileas. They're certainly easy enough to track.
There. The Morlocks appear to have taken Moreau and Elizabeth to some kind of town square.
Moreau seems to be... speaking with their leader.
Yes. He certainly has their chieftain's attention.
Then let us strike now, while their attention is elsewhere!
Moreau! Elizabeth! Quickly! While the Morlocks regroup!
Oh, we won't be going with you, Fogg.
We have reached our destination and we are quite, quite happy here with our new friends.
And the Pipes they were gracious enough to entrust to me.
Moreau lifts the Emerald Pipes to his lips, and plays.
Moreau is playing the Emerald Pipes and the Morlocks are clearly invigorated by it!
We have to get away from here!
Stick close to each other! We don't want anyone getting separated!
Fogg. Aouda. Passpartout. I must apologize. My... hubris... has led us to this.
This is a sticky wicket, to be sure.
The Eloi are good people. Their trust in me was misplaced. I must undo the damage I have done.
We must reclaim the Emerald Pipes.
And how might we do that, I wonder?
The Eloi rely upon the crystals around here for magical energy.
And now the Morlocks have them occupied.
Let's go deeper into the crystal caves!
Look. The Eloi are harvesting the crystals.
Good Eloi, we have freed some small area of the cave. Your people can be at peace for now.
Rest assured we shall not rest until we have reclaimed your crystal fields... and the Pipes.
It will not be easy. The Pipes... change things. Be on your guard.
I believe I have the knack for playing these Pipes, now.
Fogg and his friends mean to take them back, Moreau.
They may have driven off the Morlocks, true...
... but let us see how they handle the wildlife, once the Pipes have affected them.
Moreau plays the Emerald Pipes. Elizabeth's eyes widen with shock and delight.
Yes, these Pipes have made the fauna quite formidable.
Do it again! Do it again!
Moreau's evil music has corrupted this place!
I'm not sure. Something doesn't feel right...
Sounds from the Deep Lagoon. Not good.
Doctor Moreau has played the Emerald Pipes and thus corrupted the Morlock minds.
Field tests complete. Now for the main event.
Morlocks! Your time has come! The adventurers are weakened!
AND THE MUSIC MAKES US STRONG!
He is assessing our responses to his mutated army.
Clearly he intended to acquire this power for himself all along.
Moreau's grasp of the Pipes' magic is growing.
We have just begun to see what he is capable of.
ABOVE-WORLDERS! THE MORLOCKS COME FOR YOU!
We have to withdraw! There's too many!
And they definitely don't have any civilized manners.
This is all my doing. Moreau has those Pipes because of me.
I cannot retreat. I must undo what I have done. I have a plan.
Find the biggest Morlock and knock him flat.
Morlocks follow the strongest. The leader knows what we need to know.
Capture the leader, and maybe we learn something useful.
C'est vrai! What were you thinking?
They outnumbered us ten to one. Madness, Nemo.
What... ugh. What... what do you want to know?
Free of the Emerald Pipes' influence our Morlock friend seems more... himself.
Pipes... changed us Morlocks. Changed me. Not good.
Tell me, noble Morlock, of Moreau's plans.
Why do you lead us through these flooded caves, Morlock?
I don't have all the answers. Within these caves... there is one who does.
'allo there! New to the caves are we? My name's Morris.
I dig tunnels. Got 'em all over this place. Through things. Under things.
So sometimes I overhear things. My tunnels share a lot of walls, y'see.
I heard about your mate. Moreau, was it? Fella with the Emerald Pipes? Yeah.
He's gonna want to play the Dirge, he is.
Take it from Morris, ya don't want him to do that.
The dark music stole the Morlocks' minds.
That was just a warm-up, if what I overheard is any indication.
Moreau played but a small tune for you. The Dirge...
The Dirge is lament for all Creation.
And you are quite sure, Mister Morris? Moreau intends to play this "lament"?
Well, I was tunnelin' pretty briskly, y'understand.
But the word "godlike" did get used quite a bit.
When villains use such a word it's never good.
Morris. If we wish to prevent Moreau from playing such a... Dirge...
No idea. But Queen Zenobia might know.
Her mind is the mind of all she commands. Every last worker and drone.
What do you think I've been doin'? We're almost there!
Ah. You made it after all.
Your Highness, you honor us with your presence!
That... that doesn't sound like the Queen.
You always were the more slow-witted of the two of us, Phileas.
You are not wanted here, Phileas. On that subject...
... we are all of one mind.
How... how is Moreau... an insect?
He's not. It's the blasted Pipes. The Queen's thoughts are her subjects thoughts, that's what Morris said.
Moreau's Pipes have stolen the mind of the Queen. He speaks through her, thinks through her...
... and so Moreau IS the Queen. And all of her subjects.
Well... if the Queen's mind is the hive's mind... you just need to break the spell on the Queen don't ya?
Free the Queen, free every Insect in the place.
Well then, it would appear we have our work cut out for us.
Tea first, though, I should think.
That's her Grand Chamber, right there. Are you nice folk really gonna fight her?
It is my belief that Moreau's spell may be broken via the interruption of the Queen's... consciousness.
We're going to knock her out.
If we're right that should also knock out all the Insects.
Leaving Moreau with nothing to work with.
Right. Well. I better get to a good view then. This is gonna be worth seeing!
Let me guess. You think knocking me out is going to fix everything.
And why ever not, pray tell?
Because you'll never get the chance.
Look! The Insects! They all go to sleep!
The Morlock chieftain was himself after he woke. We must trust that her Highness will have her mind returned to her upon waking.
We have heard the Dirge, warmbloods.
You are free of Moreau's foul music, Highness.
The Dirge is not a melody, warmblood.
It is a voice. It speaks all languages.
And, in the language of the Octopods of the Chasm, it claims vengeance. For one you laid low.
I thought we had left our quarrel with these squids far behind!
The Dirge has great power. Reaches across all worlds.
It requires only an agent - a prophet - to be a conduit for its will.
You shamed my people, felled our Queen Ursena.
The Octopods are weak no more.
Vengeance shall be ours. Vengeance... and rebirth!
You shall be defeated once more, squidlord.
We know his Queen. A figure of evil we banished some time ago.
Oh Force of the Outer Dark! Oh Lord of the Wild Abyss!
I, Xnolphod, Most Revered Seneschal of the House of Queen Ursena beseech you!
I have journeyed far, to this strange realm, seeking you! I have sung your song! I have made the appropriate sacrifices!
I now most humbly request: Return to us Queen Ursena! Whole and glorious once more!
This I plead using your One True Name! This I plead, invoking the name... DEMIURGE!
Hm? Oh. No, I don't think so.
This cannot be. I searched. I studied. I made the offerings. I sang the most hidden of songs...
Queen Ursena. I have failed you.
"Demiurge". You called out that name. What is that?
The Dirge is not a song.
The Emerald Pipes belonged to Great King Lughaidh. Morlocks... stole them.
And that was when the Great King began to fade away from himself.
Lughaidh? Why have you not mentioned this "Great King" before?
Lughaidh was King of all Underwild. Our... protector. We fell to squabbling over the Pipes...
... and the Great King faded away from himself. All his power he invested into the Pipes. For us.
We cannot bear to speak his name, so great is our shame.
Tell me more of this Lughaidh.
"Wise Father" was our name for him. He built the Pipes to keep us safe.
Great King sang away the great darkness that would use us to fill its belly.
Then it seems to me that resolving this disaster begins with returning the Pipes to the King.
Elizabeth is spying on the group from a distance.
Moreau, my love, you must hurry!
Of course, my dove. Hold them off just a touch longer, if you would?
Moreau is playing the Emerald Pipes in hopes of turning King Lughaidh against the adventurers.
This pathetic ghost of a King is getting on my nerves.
Elizabeth, dearheart, I fell in love with a woman of strength and ruthlessness.
I need her now. Hold them back. Just a little longer and I shall have this sad old monarch singing the tune we need.
The greatest of all melodies... the one that shall sing the world to us.
You face Elizabeth now... but soon...
... soon my love and I shall be so much more.
You know, Elizabeth, I've heard a lot of these speeches in my time.
Yes... Lughaidh once sang away the Demiurge... with his wonderful Emerald Pipes.
But Moreau has them now... ... and he has Lughaidh.
With the Pipes Moreau controls the Great King... and at Moreau's command...
Lughaidh... shall sing the darkness back.
If what Elizabeth says is true then our first priority must be to free King Lughaidh.
Turn back. Or be destroyed. So speaks. King Lughaidh.
Yet we must speak with the King. We must return him to his senses.
I think I speak for all residents of the Underwild when I say...
We would very much appreciate that. We like this place.
It's got all our stuff in it.
While the heroes are searching for Lughaidh, Moreau and Elizabeth are having a dispute.
Take me with you, my love. I'm tired of fighting these fools.
Hmm. Yes. About that. You know me better than most Elizabeth.
And you know I'm not overly fond of sharing. Thank you for your aid, beautiful one.
But I'm afraid this is goodbye.
What? No! You cannot leave me with these people! Moreau! MOREAU!
You wish to stop that unfaithful cur? Topple his dreams? Very well.
Listen closely, and I will tell you how.
Eerie pipe music drifts across the camp as Moreau tries to take control of Elizabeth's mind.
I shall not reveal Moreau's plans...
Elizabeth is fighting Moreau's attempt to control her mind.
Moreau... intends to control... The Demiurge.
Elizabeth collapses to the ground, lifeless.
The heroes are reeling from the shock of witnessing Demiurge's power. Something else catches their attention.
I AM MADE CONDUIT FOR THAT VOICE.
Oh no. Our King. The music has taken our King...
Lughaidh is broken free of Moreau's control.
Heroes... I thank you... but your arrival comes too late.
The song has been sung. The walls of the Demiurge's otherworldy prison... crumble.
All that remains is the coda. The final movement...
...for Moreau to sing the Demiurge back into this world.
My friends... your King... has failed you.
Heroes, you are our only hope. Please, go forth and undo Moreau's work.
I'm right here, fools. And I'm not alone.
Why, there's an old friend of yours, right here.
And I'm sure he is eager to fight you again...
Moreau! Cease your infernal playing at once!
Elena. Manners. Your friend was quite enjoying it.
Elena. Richard. Vivica. Help me. I cannot fight it!
Akkorog?! The Demiurge is trying to control your mind. You have to be strong!
Akkorog's eyes turn dark and he raises his fist.
Akkorog, don't give in! We have to do something.
Ahh, I feel stronger than ever before. Mightier than any morlock before me.
Akkorog, this is not the real you. We don't want to fight you. You have to come back!
I'm not coming back. I have heard things. Beautiful things.
Akkorog is bruised but seemingly free from the effect of the otherwordly music.
Moreau happened. And as a result, Demiurge possessed you.
You saw what the foul Demiurge wrought upon me. It is close. Close enough to...
A deafening crescendo of music takes form... the Demiurge itself appears!
The heroes witness Demiurge descend before them.
I'm here to claim a vessel.
YES! Wait. Vessel? NO! NO THIS IS NOT PART OF OUR BARGAIN! NOOOOO!
Moreau is possessed by Demiurge's music.
I reclaim this domain. And all who dwell within.
This is no domain of yours, Fiend!
It is mine, but Underwild is merely a part of it.
My domain is without limit. My domain is all of Creation.
Enough of this! It has been a pleasure knowing you, monsieur.
Aouda, my darling. Maybe you should leave. Live to tell the tale of our expedition.
Never. I stand here amongst friends.
Time to correct my unfortunate mistake.
The dust settles and Moreau seems to regain control of his mind.
So be it. There are other vessels, eager to be filled.
And I have all the time in Creation.
Demiurge vanishes in an instant and glittering particles are left floating in its place.
You can't win them all, I suppose.
Moreau! When you were bonded with that... thing. Before we defeated it. What did you learn?
Only... that it evaluated your strengths and weaknesses. Its power is... beyond anything I have ever seen.
Then we must find it, and destroy it.
Well this was a journey unlike any other. I'm up for some tea. Anyone else?
Elena, Richard, and Vivica. Glad to see you have arrived safely here in Kemyth.
My name is Aqeela and this is Azmia.
A heartfelt welcome from both of us. May peace be with you.
Aqeela and I are the wardens of the coastal Kemyth.
Pleased to meet you! We're so excited to be here!
So excited! I can't wait to learn more about Kemyth!
First of all, what are those huge triangular constructs in the distance?
I must say, those big pointy rocks are quite a sight!
They are of great importance to us! We call them pyramids. They are the sacred resting places of our ancestors.
Please excuse us for getting distracted, Azmia and Aqeela... I'm sure we'd have more pressing matters to discuss!
True. But first and foremost, we should get going.
Uh-oh, before we do that, I think I have to ask one more question...
WHAT ARE THOSE CREATURES?! AND ARE THEY ATTACKING US?
Ha, we bested the raging beasts!
I'm not familiar with the wildlife of this region but... Something about these beasts seems wrong!
Indeed. The beasts are not well. It's also unprecedented to see this many of them in the same area.
We must continue onward before they overwhelm us.
The beasts you fought are called hippos. Some people also call them river horses.
Interesting, I certainly wouldn't call that ravenous beast a river horse!
They used to be relatively peaceful creatures...
Someone or something has changed the hippos! We are not yet certain what it was exactly, but it was definitely not a natural change!
Speaking of hippos, I see more of them coming our way!
This hippo rampage is a fascinating phenomenon, for sure. But I'd prefer not to be trampled by these murderous mammals.
Azmia, have the hippos always had such ornate armor?
No, the armor appeared when their behavior changed... The timing is suspicious.
The origins of the armor should be investigated.
Come, I think I know who we must speak with.
Who goes there? Stop in the name of the Pharaoh and be ready to explain your business here.
Oh please, Junaid. Cease your posturing! It's me and Aqeela.
But, uh, I have been ordered to guard this district. In the name of the Pharaoh, no less!
Junaid, old friend, you know we live to protect the coastal Kemyth! We are the ones fighting the danger!
Junaid, please! Fight the hippos, not us!
This is not right! Azmia and Aqeela, you can't just bring heavily armed foreigners and crazed hippos here!
This job may not be what I had in the capital, but my duty as a guard here is all I have left.
Though after what the hippos have done here, I guess I don't even have that...
Geez, Junaid, there's no need to be so dramatic. The hippos are, for now, pacified.
And at least a few of the buildings here are still standing!
That's not much comfort to me!
What the heck you even want from me? Why are you here?
Please, listen carefully. Your knowledge of the capital city, the dynasty and the Pharaoh himself may be of more use than you can imagine...
So, Azmia, I take it that this mighty land is in serious trouble? And it's not only about the hippos?
Indeed. Nowadays we keep seeing trouble after trouble...
Drought. Locusts. Odd creatures in the night. Old stories becoming true.
People like me, wardens of smaller settlements, have seen all of this.
But the Pharaoh has kept silent. As if none of this concerns him.
But the recent attack is something the Pharaoh cannot brush aside!
And your village wasn't the only one that was razed, right?
Correct. We have received news from multiple nearby villages. All attacked by wildlife or monsters...
