The countryside here sure is beautiful! It's so pleasantly busy with monsters to battle with!
You say odd things, traveler. Do you not have enough monsters where you're from?
Well, we sure do have plenty of fierce monsters back at home as well!
But I find it so refreshing to see different kinds of monsters on our travels!
It is, as Vivica would say, very educational!
Look! The royal guard Waqas approaches. He is from the capital!
Attention, travelers! The ruler of Kemyth, the father of Caiza, the everlasting wisdom of the empire, Pharaoh Ptolemy invites you to meet him!
Say what? The phantom of myths?
Richard, please dig the sand out of your ears!
Here in the land of Kemyth, the rulers are titled pharaohs!
Ptolemy is the Pharaoh! And he wants to meet us! Gosh!
Well met, royal guard. Let us discuss in the shade. We're not accustomed to the hot daytime sun of Kemyth.
So, Waqas, you're a guard of the Pharaoh? And also his herald?
Correct. I am the fastest captain of the army of Caiza. I made haste as soon as our Pharaoh learned of your imminent arrival.
Hmph, the old Pharaoh wouldn't know which foot to raise to run!
Silence, commoner! Do not insult the Pharaoh!
...even if it's true that his feet and thoughts do not always move as expected...
Ahem. Yes. So, let me tell you more about the blight that currently faces the Dynasty of Dunes...
As the sun sets, the heroes make camp and hear what the Pharaoh has for a message.
The Pharaoh in his infinite wisdom has foreseen that Caiza, our beloved capital city, may soon be attacked.
Therefore you, the mighty heroes from faraway lands, are invited to Caiza as his most esteemed guests.
Esteemed guests? Has the Pharaoh no idea that his lands are already under attack?
You talk of hippos and crocodiles? A few stray animals are not a threat to the empire!
Those were no stray animals! The creatures are as numerous as the grains of sand, and many of them wear armor adorned with gold and gems!
...armor would be at home in the treasuries of the Pharaoh...
Mind your words, Junaid! I remember you from the garrison of Caiza... you were a noble warrior, once.
But speaking or even thinking ill of the Pharaoh shows just how low you have sunk!
The heroes learn that in addition to the mysterious monster attacks, there is another danger. The people of Kemyth are also divided from within.
Yes, we've witnessed that too! Our new friends have done nothing but argue among themselves for the last few days.
It is quite tiresome, I say. There clearly is something amiss in these lands...
But we can't make heads or tails out of this while everyone is at each other's throats!
As the heroes approach a river, they notice a pair of curious characters in a heated discussion.
The riverlands are my area, not yours! You are a mere spirit of water!
Bah! You are a flea-ridden third tier deity at best! You have no power here!
Oh no... This day just keeps getting worse by the minute...
These lands are mine to look after! Mine, I say!
The river gives life to all of the lands here. And I'm the spirit of the river!
Bennu is one of the oldest gods protecting our lands, surely his claim is more rightful.
But why would Bennu meddle with the workings of a spirit of the river?
Their quarrel, no matter who is right, is causing problems here...
Look! The more they bicker, the more monstrous the local creatures become!
Why are Bennu and El Naddaha both attacking us? Gods are supposed to be on our side!
Hah, I'm not surprised. Not in the slightest!
We have plenty of experience with gods and deities not behaving nicely.
Indeed, on our travels it is more of a rule than an exception that mighty and supposedly wise beings tend to resort to aggression.
But fear not! There's no problem that my hammer hasn't been able to solve!
Yes, well, the real solutions always require wisdom and diplomacy. But to get there we may have to defend ourselves.
Right now it's definitely the latter. Let's defend ourselves by dashing headfirst into battle!
So what exactly is going on here... Why would El Naddaha leave her river?
She's the spirit of the river. She embodies the beauty of the flowing river... But rivers can also be dangerous.
Yes, both rivers and El Naddaha herself can be very dangerous! The rumours say that El Naddaha has sometimes lured people into the river's currents!
But what could have caused her to rage like this? And why involve Bennu, a peaceful deity?
I still can't believe this! The great Bennu and El Naddaha are fighting each other?
And against us! Don't forget that they lash out to everyone nearby.
I can see that, Junaid. I can also see that you still fight well, despite having left the Pharaoh's guard years ago.
One does not forget the skills acquired in service.
Hmm. I may have judged you wrong. While you look like a washed out village guard nowadays, there may be more to you than what meets the eye.
I sure hope so. If any of us is weak, we'll surely all perish on this journey!
Curses! The stupid bird and the no-less stupid river lady are no closer to settling their differences!
Watch what you say! Our gods are not stupid! But it is true that their actions make no sense...
It's as if they could not hear each other.
What? You mean that instead of fighting them, we'd try to talk to them?
That's the only thing we haven't tried so far.
Very well. Like you said, we have already exchanged quite a few punches with them... Let us see if we could get a chance to exchange some words!
After fighting Bennu and El Naddaha once more, the heroes finally get a chance to talk to them...
Gods! Spirits! Please lend us your ear and hear what we have to say!
What's this? A human has something to say?
This is curious. For some reason I can hear this human clearer than the beaked idiot.
You're the essence of our land, and now we ask you to set aside your fight!
Strange and frightful events are happening everywhere in our beloved empire.
You both, together, have the power to pacify the monsters in the riverlands.
Please, look around and see the chaos that engulfs your beautiful rivers and plentiful fields!
Is it sense I see returning to their eyes?
Or are they too far in their haze of anger?
The two gods return to their senses.
Thank you for your work, heroes. We were right to call for your aid.
Mystifying. It was as if a spell was binding me. Blinding me from reason.
Concerning. The jubilee, could this be? But first, let us tend to the wreckage.
Our lands are being ravaged. There is something awry. Please help us.
Naturally. By my power, the river beasts' rage should slowly subside.
But I sense my quarrel with dear Bennu was not the source of this chaos ‚Äî merely a symptom.
Precisely. Head to the west, little ones. There awaits your guide.
West is where the old abandoned tombs are. No one would be there. A guide...?
Isn't the way to the Pharaoh to the east? We'd be taking a detour.
It would be wise to heed Bennu's guidance. I can inform the Pharaoh of the delay.
Good. Azmia, I will head back to help our people. Continue on with the heroes.
All right. Stay safe. We'll get to the bottom of this, no doubt.
Mighty heroes, I will now head to Caiza to brief the Pharaoh. He shall await you there.
Of course. We'll head over to the capital once we're done here.
Splendid. We will prepare a welcoming feast befitting your arduous journey.
It was good to see you alive and well, Junaid. May our paths cross again beneath the sun.
Let's head inside. I wonder who our guide might be... and why they're waiting for us in an abandoned tomb.
These tombs are fascinating... but very unsettling. I feel uneasy.
Abandoned it may be, the layout looks pretty standard. I wouldn't worry that much.
Could really use some torches, though. And I'm no big fan of these scarabs.
Hold up! Do you see that cat over there ‚Äî at the far end?
What cat? I can't see anything.
I think it's telling us to follow that way! Come on, let's catch up to it.
Wait! Don't rush ahead so recklessly!
Richard, what do you have to say for yourself?
You led us straight into a pack of enemies! Those cats were mummies!
Look, I'm really sorry! But I swear the cat I saw was different. It wasn't a mummy.
All we've been doing here is fighting monsters. Why did Bennu tell us to go this way?
I'm sure we'll get to know soon. Have faith ‚Äî his guidance has never led us astray.
Not much use in talking now. Let's head onwards.
Interesting! This part of the tomb is lit with torches.
It shouldn't be. Someone has been here recently. Stay on your guard.
A stocky figure emerges from the shadows at the far end of the hall.
In the name of the Pharaoh... state who you are... or else! I have... um... weapons!
Wait, I recognize that voice. Could it be... Hey Jarif, is that you?
AZMIA? JUNAID? Hurrah! Blessed be, I'm saved! Uh... who are these foreigners?
What on earth are you doing here, of all places? Shouldn't you be in Caiza?
I heard there might be an Amulet here that could rejuvenate Pharaoh Ptolemy...
Let's catch up later! More monsters are coming this way. Raise your blades!
Praise the sun... I might have starved to death if you all hadn't found me.
You silly scribe. Azmia or I could have come along if you had just told us.
What were you thinking, coming here all by yourself? So reckless! As always!
He doesn't look warworn at all, though. How did he reach this part of the tombs?
Some mysterious shadow kept leading monsters away from my path. It was eerie!
Wait. Did the shadow look like a cat?
Now that I think about it, yes. It very well might have been a cat.
I TOLD YOU THERE WAS A CAT!
Mind the acoustics, Richard! My ears are ringing.
Anyway, I guess you were right, Azmia. Bennu did send us here for a reason.
Not to sound too much like that fine gentleman, but ‚Äî I told you!
The group nears the exit, but monsters continue to chase after them.
Curses. Why aren't they sticking to their territory?
It may be due to the Amulets we're carrying. I believe they naturally attract monsters.
No complaints from me! More things to smash with my hammer!
I'm just glad we're not fighting hippos anymore. I wouldn't want to be in an underground tomb with one.
All thanks to El Naddaha. Now they're probably relaxing somewhere in the rolling meadows above us.
Or swimming in the river. Anyway, let's press on and get out of here. To greener pastures.
A group of gods have been closely watching the group's journey through Kemyth.
Impressive. The little ones from the otherworld are doing well... almost too well.
Nay! Their first true test draws nigh. Few mortals can match Papyros, let alone Sobek.
Perhaps. Those fell beings will not yield easily. Yet I expect the mortals to overcome.
Verily. Much lies ahead, but they have begun scratching the surface of this jubilee.
Indeed. Speaking of scratching ‚Äî where has Bastet gone off to?
Curious. Some moons ago she ambled out for a stroll. I presume she is still away.
I think we've seen the last of those tomb monsters. Good work, everyone!
Wait, look! More enemies up ahead.
No... How? This is the Pharaoh's very own forest. No foe should set foot here!
I can't believe this. What on earth is happening to Kemyth?
These heretics have been wreaking havoc in this area for some time now, sadly.
This doesn't look good. These enemies look trained. Let's proceed with caution.
Impossible! No mortal should withstand the might of my Sand Golems.
INCREDIBLE! You heroes have done what even the Pharaoh's guards could not!
So that's how low the guards have sunk. Pathetic. No wonder nothing gets done.
Junaid, I know you never listen, but MIND YOUR TONGUE in front of officials!
Especially in front of such esteemed foreign guests! Oh, if only Waqas was here!
Hey gang, I think this bad guy has something dramatic to say.
Riffraff! You will be no match for Sobek. Go on ahead and find out for yourselves.
That wasn't very dramatic at all!
I'm glad we're making good progress, but I'm starting to miss my boys back home.
I miss my daughter too, but I'm sure Aqeela's taking real good care of everyone.
Oh I'm not worried, I know how good she is with kids. Just feeling a bit homesick.
Hey Junaid, if you don't mind me asking, why did you leave the Pharaoh's guard?
It's a VERY long story! And you wouldn't want the full version!
To put it simply, I lost faith in the kingdom and decided to protect my people myself.
I must admit Kemyth is going through very dark times. But I believe the Pharaoh can lead us back to glory.
As usual, we'll agree to disagree. Respectfully, of course.
Halt ‚Äî enemies ahead! These must be Sobek's forces.
Well, once more from the top!
Splendid! You mongrels know how to fight! Especially you with the hammer!
That wasn't too bad a workout.
Such spectacular power! I'm sure that with your help, Caiza will withstand any assault!
False! You fools are late. The hour is nigh! Kemyth will soon return to its true owners!
HA! Mortal ‚Äî I shall recount your jape for centuries to come! Well done! AHAHAHA!
Hurry, let's move while he's busy laughing. We've almost reached the capital!
The group reaches the outskirts of Caiza.
Halt! In the name of the ‚Äî wait, JARIF? Why are you all the way out here?
Good to see you again, Waqas! Long story. Let us lead our guests to the city first.
Of course. Mighty heroes, allow me to welcome you to Caiza! You have truly arrived just in time!
We have just been informed that an invasion is imminent. The enemy approaches. We ask for your aid!
Waqas hurriedly leads the group to the city entrance guarded by Cleopatra and her troops.
HALT! What is this, Waqas? Who are these pale-faced infidels of outlandish garb?
Your benevolence, Lady Cleopatra! Please allow me to exp‚Äì
My apologies. I had not known you were esteemed guests of the Pharaoh.
Any fault is mine and mine alone, Lady Cleopatra! It is I who have failed to inform you beforehand!
No hard feelings ‚Äî I respect vigilance. Your city's security seems to be in good hands.
Normally, yes. Now, not quite. We are in urgent need of mighty warriors such as yourselves.
Waqas briefed us on the situation! Let's hurry inside and make preparations.
Absolutely! Please follow me to the barracks. I shall atone for my failure afterwards.
By any chance, would any of you have seen a certain cat on your way here?
A horde of enemies storm Caiza on all fronts. An undead ruler leads the army.
Noble heroes, forgive my welcome being cut short. It seems as if the blight has finally reached Kemyth.
Your Highness, with all due respect, the blight already had ‚Äì
This is NOT the time, Junaid! Come on, let's move!
Your true queen has at last arrived! People of Kemyth, surrender your arms!
Could that be... no, impossible! The late Pharaoh Ahhotep?... How could this be?
CHARGE! The sun smiles upon our blades! Those who resist shall not be spared!
Ahhotep's army suffer a heavy defeat and begin to disperse.
YOU SCUM WILL PAY FOR YOUR TREACHERY!
I fear they may return, but a win is a win, even if we have also suffered losses.
And we'll be better prepared next time. Thank you once again for your aid, heroes.
Kemyth is forever in your debt, valiant heroes! The sun smiles eternal upon you.
As both belated welcome and victory celebration, let us head towards the farmlands for a grand feast!
I shall stay in the city and attend to any urgent administrative matters that may arise. Jarif?
At your service, Lady Cleopatra. Please enjoy yourselves at the feast, everyone!
This is the best meal I've ever had! And we've had food in five different worlds!
I'll say! I LIVE here and I've never even seen half of what's on these tables.
It is a shame Lady Cleopatra could not come.
I'm quite taken with her. Few royals we've met have been so vigilant, fierce, and responsible.
That sentiment is widely shared. I believe she may now be ready to lead Kemyth back to glory.
Dark times have fallen upon the kingdom these past few years. Rulers must take responsibility.
My mind has dulled... The gods have grown further away. Perhaps that itself had been a message...
Your Highness! Apologies for interrupting the festivities, but enemies are storming the premises!
That mummy queen is pretty persistent, huh? Mounting a second attack with only stragglers...
Feeble as my mental faculties may be, I do not believe all this is her doing.
Your Highness, could there be traitors within Caiza? Treason must be punished with death!
No Pharaoh would willingly return from the afterlife just to rule again... I fear the gods may be involved.
Far to the east there lies a secluded pyramid of great sacral import. Answers may be found there.
Faiez! Get over here. Can you guide these guests of the Pharaoh to the royal pools?
They are mighty warriors, so safety won't be a concern. You need not follow them beyond the pools.
Right sir. Esteemed guests, please follow me this way.
As the falcon flies, the royal pools aren't very far away. But by foot the journey is quite roundabout.
If I remember correctly, we'd need to trek all the way to Sunrise Falls and circle around the waterfall.
Correct sir. The exact route changes a bit every year due to flooding season, but we always circle the falls.
How have things been in Caiza proper? We're from the port area. You've heard about the hippos, right?
Tell me about it, ma'am. Those hippos were here as well. Not to mention all the bandits and monsters.
It's a long way to Sunrise Falls, right? Plenty of time to share our tales of misery on the road.
There had been murmurs in Caiza about three mighty heroes coming to our aid. I see the rumors were true!
Nah, these foes were nothing compared to... what was his name... that crocodile guy with the blades?
Sobek... SOBEK? How? I can't believe there were mortals who can even take on the gods' wrath.
I know it sounds unlikely, but it's true. We've travelled together all the way from the port.
Bennu, El Naddaha, Papyros... We've fought against quite a number of deities here already, haven't we?
And crazed hippos, and mummy cats, and an undead pharaoh. Haven't had a moment to relax.
Wow. I do love tending to my batch of crops, but in times like these, I wish I were an adventurer!
Ugh. I'm still in shock from seeing ‚Äî the late Pharaoh Ahhotep, was it? Undead... like that.
Same! And it didn't feel like any sorcery was involved. I couldn't detect any magic at all. It was eerie!
Pharaoh Ptolemy is right. First the royal armor on the hippos, now this ‚Äî no mortal could do such things.
But I don't understand what a god would have to gain from doing such things.
Draped in blindingly bright sunlight, a falcon-headed figure suddenly materializes in front of the group.
Halt! Long have I awaited your arrival.
Could it possibly be... no! Horus the Great!
Splendid! You have proven yourselves worthy of the challenges ahead.
To meet Horus the Great in person... As a guard of Kemyth, no greater honor exists. My life is complete.
Heed! These glorious lands have lately been marred with chaos ‚Äî you all know this well.
Harmony. Order. These glories of the sun must be restored. Find and defeat the instigator of this disarray.
Set! His infamy precedes him. A feeble foe he is not. Yet neither is he insurmountable. Let him learn that.
It will be done. We swore to protect our land against any threat, against any odds. So... even against gods.
Please watch over us as we journey onwards.
Superb. Worry not ‚Äî you will feel the presence of my eye.
Erm... sorry if this is something we should be aware of, but who is this "Set"?
Goodness, don't apologize ‚Äî we don't expect outlanders to know all about our gods! That'd be silly.
Horus and Set are enemies. Their feud started long before I was even born. It seems it's still going strong
Set is a rogue god who often seeks to wreak havoc. Horus the Great protects Kemyth and its people.
Well, we have plenty of experience fighting rogue deities. Feels like we're always meeting more of them.
Another falcon-headed figure suddenly emerges from the shade of a nearby dune.
Hmm? Here already? How grand! Such swiftness!
Excellent! You're just as capable as Horus described ‚Äî and I had hoped.
Uh, so you're one of the good ones, right?
Alas! Unbearably reductive ‚Äî it seems your intellect lags far behind your strength.
Good? Evil? Such ideas are but mortal fables. I assume you ask whether I oppose Set? That, I do.
If I may ‚Äî Horus the Great tasked us with stopping Set. May we ask you to bless us with your wisdom?
Pharaoh Ptolemy advised us to head to the secluded pyramid. Would we be right in staying our course?
Ptolemy? An intriguing piece of information. Perhaps he was of sounder mind than we had judged...
Proceed! Continue as instructed by your ruler. More will be unveiled to you as you head onward.
The terrain around these parts changed a lot since my last visit. Granted, it was some time ago, but still.
Sounding like an old man again, Junaid. But true, we would've gotten lost or hurt had Faiez not been here.
Or have wasted a lot of time by not taking as many shortcuts as we did!
Suggesting a such great guide was a rare moment of wisdom from Waqas. Thank you for coming, Faiez.
Nothing doing, sir. Not much left to go ‚Äî we're almost at the oasis now. It's just a few dunes over.
By the way, word is that new types of scarabs have been seen here recently. Wonder if we'll get to see any!
We've met all sorts of enemies, but sticky exploding beetles? I don't recall facing things like these before.
I don't think so, either. Well, at least they seemed to be weak to your healing spells. Good to know.
Many Kemythian scarabs have incredible, almost magical properties. Even to us, they're largely a mystery.
So you're saying it's a feature, not a bug!
The explosions aren't what surprised me. Scarabs aren't supposed to be this hostile. Something's wrong.
I wonder why the enemy leader we faced didn't breathe a word, unlike all the other bosses we've fought.
Is that... bugging you? Heh heh.
At last! So we've reached the edge of the oasis area ‚Äî wait, what's going on?
So many scarabs... they're just swarming all over the place. And they look vicious. This isn't normal, right?
Definitely not. What a bizarre sight. Guess we'll have to fight our way through all that to get to the pools.
It seems nowhere is safe from the blight. At this point I'm starting to miss fighting off crazy hippos.
I'll say. I'm pretty good with bugs, but even for me this is a bit on the hideous side.
Well, all the more reason to take Set down as soon as possible. Let's get going.
Exceptional. Judging from our spar, you should be able to cut a way through without too much trouble.
This... infestation. It isn't your doing, right? It didn't seem like you were trying to set those beetles on us.
Correct. They no longer respond well to orders. A malign influence swirls around them, like a sandstorm.
Beware! For now, I can contain them to this area. But not forever. Once they escape... death will follow.
Scoratek ‚Äî you must have met him on your way here. He, too, has been inflicted. Did he cause harm?
Not much! He wasn't much of a talker, though.
Encouraging. Now, head onwards while the sun still shines. You will not want to be here when it gets dark.
Thank the gods! At least the Pharaoh's two pools are safe from the scarabs. The outpost looks intact, too!
Couldn't be more grateful to Khepri for keeping those things locked down there. Always looking out for us.
Imagine if they make their way to a village. We need to find Set before they can escape Khepri's control.
Anyway, thank you for guiding us here, Faiez. How will you be returning to Caiza? Surely not now, alone?
No worries about me! I've guided others here before. I will stay at the outpost and wait for the next patrol.
It was a great honor to guide you all, if only for a short while. Kemyth's fate seems to lie in your hands.
We'll do what we can. Hope to see you again, Faiez. And please send Waqas our warmest regards.
...although that'll only go to his head. Anyway, let's continue onwards. I think the pyramid was ‚Äî this way.
HA! Once again you mongrels prove to be entertaining! GREATLY entertaining! You may pass!
I certainly wasn't expecting to see you again! But thanks for letting us pass, I guess?
Why did you follow us all the way here? Are you trying to slow us down? Are you in alliance with Set?
"Alliance"? Another one of your silly human constructs. Strong gods have no use for such pacts!
Foolish! You can band together all you want. Even a mere titan could easily crush at least thirty mortals!
He said we can pass and we're in a hurry! Come on, let's just move on before he changes his mind.
Hold up. Someone's waving at us from under that tree. Probably not a foe, but let's approach with caution.
Near the base of the mountain, the group find a very familiar face waiting for them.
AQEELA? Well, I'll be! How did you get here? Is everyone back home alright? Are the hippos gone?
Things are back to normal near the port, thanks to El Naddaha's protection and everyone's hard work.
I also stopped by Caiza on my way here and heard all about your exploits. You're all considered heroes.
How did you get here so quickly all the way from the port? It took ages for us to get here just from Caiza!
Boats started running again after the hippos calmed down. Anyway, I heard the Pharaoh told you to ‚Äî
Head to the secluded pyramid, right. But it's been long since I've been there last, so the road's unclear.
Looks like I came back just in time. I happen to know this area pretty well. I'll lead the way.
Bit of a hike this is! We're still far off the peak. Haven't gone up a real mountain in quite a while.
At least there's this very well-marked road. I assume we can stick to it all the way?
Actually no. People have been known to go missing on this road. I'd say we're already in danger.
There's a hidden shortcut up ahead. Going that way will be less risky. I'll go check if the path's still intact.
Aqeela sprints ahead alone. The rest of the group follow her lead.
Aqeela's always been knowledgeable, but how is she this well acquainted with this... middle-of-nowhere?
I'll say! I have no idea at all.
The terrain's a bit rough, but we seem to be saving quite some time by going this way.
And the view's very nice! Thanks for taking us this way, Aqeela.
The tough part's almost over. Not much left to go now.
The group reach a clearing and is greeted by a lion-headed figure. She signals them to stop.
Halt! You must be the mortals Horus saw. Well met. Beyond this point you may reunite with your guide.
Guide? But Faiez is back there at the pools. And um, what was his ‚Äî Jarif? He can't be here, can he?
Hmm? Amongst mortals she goes by many names and forms. But those two I have never heard.
Hey, maybe this is the guide Bennu mentioned! We thought it was Jarif, but maybe it was someone else?
Riddles... Enjoy those with the sphinxes. I seek to test your strength, not your wit. Raise your weapons!
Superb. All of you look well prepared for the task ahead. Especially you, from the nearby village.
There's a village here? And who?... oh. That does explain why you knew this area so well! Mystery solved.
Look, I was only born there. I haven't been there since forever. My loyalty is to the people of Kemyth.
Hold up, I don't follow. So there's a village here... but it isn't a part of Kemyth?
Yes and no. It's not really a village, more like a hideout. And its people deeply resent the current royals.
Very few outsiders know of it, and it'd be best if it stays that way. I trust you two won't breathe a word.
I can certainly guess as to why. No need for needless bloodshed. Don't worry, the secret's safe with us.
And knowing this won't change our view of you at all! You know, just in case you were wondering.
Touching. But you do not have time to dally. Mortals, proceed. If all goes well, we will meet again soon.
Hello. Are you supposed to be our guide?
Wait... This is the cat that led all the scarabs away from me when I was crossing the oasis area alone.
Hey ‚Äî THIS IS THAT CAT! FROM THE TOMBS!
Correct! But I do have a name for this form? And for a mortal, you're quite loud!
Please forgive him, he's always like this. Could you tell us your name, if you don't mind us asking?
Maybe? If you entertain me for a bit. Catch me if you can!
You're a bit too fast for us, Bastet...
Delightful! That was a fun tussle. But I wasn't being very fast! I think you're just a bit slow!
Anyway. Now for more pressing matters! Have you outlanders heard of Set?
Yes, we've given them a brief rundown. And Horus the Great, among others, have spoken of Set to us.
Good! So Set despises the current ruler, who shuns him and only worships Horus. Set finds it insulting!
Ptolemy ‚Äî Set wants to replace him with a past pharaoh, one from a bloodline that respected him!
That sounds a bit petty, to be honest.
Ahhotep! She was Set's first choice. You stopped her, so now other royal mummies are being prepared!
So Set's dragging back their souls from the afterlife and using them against their will? That's horrible!
Indeed. But many gods tend to do improper things when they feel slighted. Quite unseemly!
I think we've seen a few examples of that in other worlds we've been to...
Well, we should hurry to that secluded pyramid. Maybe we could stop Set from raising another pharaoh.
Unlikely! But that pyramid should still remain your destination. Off you go now ‚Äî head straight south!
As much as I'm critical about the state of the empire, what Set's trying to do is unthinkable.
I don't think even the Pharaoh's worst enemies would prefer to be ruled by an undead mummy pharaoh.
Well... I'm not sure about that. You may be surprised.
I'm not sure if I completely got what Bastet told us. Why did Kemyth's older rulers worship a god like Set?
Jarif once told me that in ancient times, Set used to be worshipped as a protector, like Horus the Great.
Also, even now, some areas quietly continue to worship Set. I may or may not know of one such place...
Honestly, I don't think we'll ever be able to understand what gods do, or why. It's all far beyond us mortals.
But right now, Horus is protecting us while Set's apparently seeking to harm us. That's all I need to know.
You again? Are you allied with Set?
Silence! Dare not utter his name with your filthy mortal tongue.
Is it true he's trying to bring back another ancient pharaoh? Back from the dead?
Riffraff ‚Äî your utter ignorance blinds you. Do you fools not see what this land needs?
Your sand golems really aren't that durable. Have you thought of using some other material?
INSOLENCE! Sobek will soon hunt you down. Go pick out a dune you'd prefer to be buried under.
Was Papyros also originally a friendly god? Is he under some evil influence?
I have no idea at all, to be honest ‚Äî I couldn't recognize his name or appearance.
Neither could I. Then again, we've never really known how many gods there are in Kemyth.
True. Maybe Jarif might have known something, though.
Or maybe Papyros wasn't a god at all! Could he just have been a very capable underling?
AH! Marvelous as expected. And hammer boy, you should join my crew!
Eh... you seem cool and I'm always up for a good brawl, but helping Set? That doesn't sit right with me.
Hmm? Is he not causing a glorious mayhem? This land hasn't been this restless in ages! It's delightful!
If I may offer a word ‚Äî Set has only been wreaking havoc by warping other beings' minds.
He may have his reasons, but not once has he led his minions himself from the front lines.
Well said. I do not believe such behavior befits the support of a truly powerful deity such as yourself!
A genuinely fearless god like Sobek would not resort to such roundabout, conniving methods.
Hmm! You mortals DO understand my power and glory well! I shall give your pleas some consideration.
I didn't expect Sobek to be that agreeable! Hey, maybe Set could be talked out of his plans too!
That approach did work before, like back when we ran into Bennu and El Naddaha...
I don't expect much to come out of that, unfortunately. Set is nothing like the gods we've met.
A chilling gust of wind, somehow also laced with scorching grains of sand, blows from behind the group.
Set! The enemy is here. Ready your weapons!
...impudent. Dare interrupt me again, mortal, and you will be taught anew the meaning of pain.
Heroes! This land has long yearned for a reckoning. Do not let those brainwashed vermin fool you.
Justice. Order. Surely these are the values you champion? If so, you three are more than welcome to join me.
No, we know all about what you've been up to. We're here to stop you.
Confused? That can be remedied. I am here to save this land from its misery. Do you not wish the same?
I don't think talking with this guy will achieve much!
Are you really doing all this out of spite? Just because you're not being worshipped enough?
Disappointing. Critical thinking is clearly not your forte. I shall kindly indulge your ignorance.
Answer. Do the people of this land look happy with their ruler? Is their kingdom being managed well?
Good. Do you not agree that a poor, helpless ruler should be replaced by an experienced and capable one?
Good. That is enough. In time, we will meet again. I shall grant you one more chance to submit then.
Refuse... and I will then consider you equal to these blind fools who have been contaminating your mind.
Children ‚Äî class dismissed. Carry on now with your little adventure, if you wish. What you do matters not.
Hey gang, you all look a bit downbeat. Something on your mind?
Well... It's what Set said. I'm still convinced we must stop him. But I can't help but wonder...
...whether he had a point, despite his methods of madness?
Yeah. Records say Pharaoh Ahhotep was one of Kemyth's greatest rulers, right? We've all heard that.
Despite my grumblings, I will still defend the Pharaoh to my death against any threat to his rule or life.
But if a wiser Pharaoh could rule again ‚Äî would not a bloodless abdication be within reason?...
Ugh. I don't know how to answer that. It really isn't something we'd ever had a reason to think about before.
Greetings. You have done well to make it this far.
Welcome. Judging by your faces, you have already run into Set. Did our little workout help clear your minds?
Our commitment to defeating him remains steadfast. But the seeds of doubt he has planted among us...
I can only speak for myself, but they're still there, festering.
Understandable. Worry not. On the road to the secluded pyramid lies a tomb. Take care to pay it a visit.
Danger lies inside, and what you see may disgust you ‚Äî but the sight should help you see more clearly.
Agreed! And chin up! I do not doubt you mortals will prevail!
BASTET! Where have you been all this time?
The group enter the tomb Eset mentioned and find it swarming with mummies.
Eset was right! This looks dangerous, and I already am a bit disgusted.
It's quite a sight for sure... but I wouldn't be surprised if there's something worse ahead.
At the very least, I don't think all these mummies would be here without a leader of some sort.
Well done, children. But now you see how futile your resistance is.
How does it feel to fight against what is already dead? Would you like to try again?
Their insolence warrants PUNISHMENT! How DARE you filth inconvenience Kemyth's true owners?
Hush, dearest. This is but a brief delay. These fools cannot stop the inevitable.
All the other mummies here are clearly not of sound mind. Weren't they your former subjects?
Indeed! Long ago, all of them swore to serve us in life and in death. Bless their loyalty!
Loyal? Or brainwashed? They don't seem to have any intelligence or agency. What have you done?
Watch your words, scum. Or don't ‚Äî it matters not. Soon you will have no use for your tongue.
Or no tongue at all! But don't let them goad you, dear. Let them chatter on their way out.
The group finally reach and enter the secluded pyramid.
So many mummies... I thought we saw a lot in those tombs, but there's even more here.
There must be something up here, just as Pharaoh Ptolemy suspected.
I truly hope it's not another set of deranged former pharaohs like the two we just saw.
No time to waste. Let's get to the bottom of this. For Kemyth!
Ma'at shakes her head from side to side, blinking slowly as if awoken from a long stupor.
Ugh... Where is this? Who are you mortals? Was there some kind of battle here just now?
Honorable Ma'at, we are blessed to be in your presence. We're in the secluded pyramid east of Caiza.
Until just ago, you seemed to be under some malign influence, just like a few other gods we've met.
We're from the port area. These heroes here are from a faraway land who've been helping us stop Set.
Hmm... ah, it's all starting to come back. I was lured here and trapped by Set. But after that... not much.
Humiliating. I had assumed he might have finally changed his ways... Thank you for your aid, mortals.
Your being sealed here explains much ‚Äî the absence of order has been sorely felt in Kemyth as of late.
Distressful. My resumed presence will soon tip the scales back a bit. But the fount of this chaos is Set.
On that matter, all the deities we've met so far seem to be aligned. We will do our best to stop him.
Having freed Ma'at, the group exit the secluded pyramid.
So... where to next? I don't think we've received any directions beyond this pyramid.
I've never ventured beyond this point either. It might not be wise to just blindly head forward...
Salutations! Worry not, your guide is back. Once again you must head east! I shall lead you.
Bastet! You always seem to be around wherever we go.
Indeed! But this arrangement will end soon. This is the homestretch. Your journey's end draws near.
Splendid. You mortals look more than ready to put up a challenge against Set.
That's our plan. But we're also not sure how to take out those reawakened mummy pharaohs.
Ah ‚Äî of that, you need not worry. If Set can be properly pinned down, they may be freed.
Respite ‚Äî let us grant it to those poor souls, who are not acting of their own volition.
That sounds absolutely horrible... dragged back from the afterlife, just to be used against one's will.
I'm just relieved to hear that those pharaohs are just under some spell, and not actually that crazy.
And who on earth would really want to be ruled over by an undead mummy?
Rulership... Mortals always fight over its forms and exercisers, despite all of them being deeply flawed.
Yet even so, they must be allowed to choose their own poison. What Set is doing is unacceptable.
Is it only me, or has the air suddenly gotten a bit... heavy? Cold? I don't know how to put it.
I know what you mean ‚Äî it started a while ago. A kind of chill... it feels very off. I don't like this.
Perceptive! We are indeed now very near Set's fortress of evil. But surely you're not turning back now?
Excellent. Your display of strength assures me that you are well prepared for the task at hand.
Yet ‚Äî the challenge will still be monumental. Most of Set's forces are garrisoned in the pyramid ahead.
Tremble! For a veritable ocean of enemies await!
Indeed. Only by wading through that army will you reach Set and his... undead pharaoh generals.
Despair! For the going will surely be arduous beyond belief!
Hmm? Just trying to cheer these mortals up with a little pep talk!
We will proceed no matter what lies ahead. We cannot rest until peace is brought to Kemyth.
See ‚Äî it works! Well, now that that's settled, I shall leave to attend to some new urgent matters.
Relax! I am sure you will fare fine by yourselves for a little while.
Agreed. Mortals ‚Äî we may meet again sooner than you expect. Until then, best of luck.
Those filth are finally here. Let us prepare to greet them. Revenge shall be delicious.
A bit optimistic, dear. We need to first see if the vermin even manage to reach us here.
Surely there's no need to gut our future subjects? Would they not be of good use once reformed?
Insolence is a frightful disease, Ahmose. Best to stamp it out lest any useful servant catches it.
That I can agree with. I do look forward to judging them with my own eyes soon...
At this point I'm not sure whether we can actually take these mummies down. They don't stay down.
And we're still yet to see Set. Anubis said he'd be here...
Let's not let our guard down. Vivica, any ideas?
Welcome! Mortals, I have eagerly expected your arrival. Have you given my offer some thought?
Hardly, but it was about time you showed your face instead of hiding behind your underlings.
Shame. I offer you a better world, and you instead wish to die in vain.
Ha! I shall gladly fulfill your desire!
Looks like we'll have to settle this once and for all, then. Friends, let's give it everything we've got!
Are we sure we can take him? He's looking far more forbidding than last time...
Suddenly, a throng of familiar faces join the scene.
Heroes ‚îÄ worry not! You won't be fighting alone.
We, the gods of Kemyth, shall be giving you our aid!
Mortals! You have done well, as we knew you would.
Anubis! Eset! Let us grant these poor souls some peace. I'll keep this rogue occupied.
The two gods start freeing the mummies' souls. One by one, Ahhotep, Tetisheri, and Ahmose stop moving.
Good. In due time, the rest of the mummies should also become unchained from this fiend's mind.
Set ‚Äî your feud with Horus may not be our business, but your antics have truly crossed the line this time.
Congratulations! I see everything all worked out and everyone played a part! Delightful!
Bastet ‚Äî thank you for your coordinating efforts. Peace has been restored to this land... for now, at least.
Indeed. And may all the long-past-dead dragged out of the field of reeds swiftly return to their repose.
We cannot thank you enough, heroes. Kemyth is forever in your debt! Your names will go down in history.
All the damage Set has wrought won't disappear overnight, though...
Yes. Unfortunately, we still may be in some need of your strength.
We'll return to this world for as long and as many times it takes. It wouldn't be the first time we've done so.
Let's head back to Caiza to deliver the good news! This occasion calls for the absolute grandest of feasts!
Welcome all to the Kingdom of Atlantis!
Another cycle of the waves has gone and here we are to raise our tridents yet again.
It seems like the entire 7 seas have gathered here.
Thank you for accepting my invitation.
This is one of the most important days for all sea-kind.
Tell me about the Atlantean Games.
What do we actually do as participants?
We fight for the glory of Atlantis!
Sounds like your kind of competition Richard.
Be careful, Lasalle is the reigning champion.
Really? He looks like he can barely swing a sword!
This is the result of choice A
This is the result of choice B
What was up with these guys!?
There was something familiar about them.
True, there's something not quite right here.
They reminded me of the minions of Ursena.
No time to explain, they're fleeing into deeper waters!
This for certain doesn't look good.
That's because they are being strengthened by a dark power.
How come there are still remnants of Ursena's corruption?
I don't know, but we must warn Ariel and Poseidon about this.
I can't believe how you can swing that hammer with such might under the sea.
I have had some practice! Bwahaha!
Congratulations! I wouldn't expect any less from the heroes that saved Atlantis.
Richard laughs, patting his flexed bicep.
We didn't do it alone, we had a lot of help on the way.
You banished the threat to Atlantis.
A threat even I fell victim to.
The Jhag'r fish-people of Ifa√≠steio seem to be causing mayhem outside the palace.
Our heroes are back in Atlantis
The corruption left by Ursena remains.
Ursena is not behind the corruption that lingers, my young friends.
Ah, Galapago! Do you know more of this?
I believe I do, your majesty. I did study the corruption after the defeat of Ursena.
This is a whole new evil that is influencing our realm from the darkest depths.
Then we must stop it in its tracks!
Yes, we should start by going to the deepest trenches below Atlantis near where Ursena used to be imprisoned.
Wow! I've never been this deep below Atlantis before.
This whole place is overrun by corruption.
The magic Poseidon used to imprison Ursena was very powerful.
The dark influence from the depths must have weakened the magic seal.
So there was another powerful evil helping Ursena?
It's an ancient artifact, let me have a look.
There are many mysteries in the deep that even I don't know about.
Yoink! That will be mine now.
I'll be taking the artifact back thank you!
I could have fetched a high price for that.
It seems to be a map to a temple hidden in the trench caverns.
I wonder if we'll find any treasures of the deep.
Looks like we have reached the temple.
If I wasn't a valiant warrior, I would describe this area as creepy.
Careful, we're not the only ones here!
It seems to be so, the entrance appears to be desecrated.
Watch out land dweller, this temple is old and full of danger...
It's too dark to see in here.
Do not worry child, I am the keeper of this temple.
We are investigating the corruption coming from the deep. This artifact showed us the way here.
Ah, very good. You must return the artifact to the heart of this temple.
You see, this temple has been a barrier. It has kept the nightmares living in the darkest crevices of the deep far away from the surface.
But ever since the artifact went missing, the corruption has been growing stronger.
This temple is much larger than I anticipated.
An aeon ago this temple used to house thousands of keepers like myself.
I had read stories of the existence of a temple such as this, but for a long time I believed it to be a mere legend.
Yes, my predecessors did safeguard knowledge of the location of this temple...
Ultrox is gesturing the party to move forward.
Please, we are near the inner sanctum.
This guy is giving me the creeps.
Tell me about it. Don't lower your guard.
Place the artifact on the pedestal.
I have a bad feeling about this.
I don't know what other choice we have. If we turn back now, we are out of clues.
Elena places the artifact on the pedestal. The room rumbles.
I am the true ruler of the seas...
How could you defeat the Empress?!
You are the true enemy of the seas.
You will perish with this temple.
The temple rumbles and starts sinking deeper into the depths.
Our heroes are at the ruins of the now sunken temple.
No. All I know is the temple sank and now we're stuck in this dark cavern.
Come, we have to find the others!
Glad to see you are safe. Where is Elena?
She has been unresponsive since the temple's collapse.
It's still dangerous here, we should try finding some safety.
This place is impossible to navigate.
If I would make a scholarly guess, I'd say we are very close to the heart of the depths.
I just wish it wasn't so dark in here!
Calm down! I know we got started on the wrong foot.
My intentions are sincere. I can help you get out of this crevice.
It seems we have no choice. We are lost.
Last thing I remember was fighting Ultrox.
The temple sank and since then we have been lost in these caverns.
I don't really understand why, but this place feels familiar.
We would be entering the heart of darkness itself. I would advise against that.
Trust me, I think I know how we can stop the corruption threatening Atlantis.
Ah, the thrill of adventure begins to stir my soul.
The pressure of the deep begins to truly weigh heavy on us.
I'm not sure this is the way out.
I don't know why, but this direction reminds me of...
Elena, are you sure you're alright?
We'd best keep moving forward, there is no reason to go back now. We will find a way to the surface soon enough.
Are we really getting closer to the surface?
It feels we have been in the deep for a long time.
I miss clear and sunny waters...
I'm alright, I'll just stand up.
Elena, your eye color seems to be changing.
Back off, we don't have time for this. Enemies approach!
There's a vast city on the ocean floor.
I would never have imagined something so large to be hiding all the way down here.
This is the Capital of the Deep.
It feels like it's calling to me...
Were you leading us here all this time?
I believe something happened to Elena at the Temple.
Perhaps the answers lie in that very city.
I hope there isn't a trap waiting for us down there.
We have been fighting our way down to this abyss, but we still have no answers.
I hope the welcome wasn't too rough.
I am Gestalt, Prince of the Deep.
Though you may not know of me, you have been battling me all this time.
All touched by the Deep share a connection that eventually transcends the individual.
It's the same spells Ursena used to control Atlantis.
I wouldn't call it a spell. It's a collective need to be part of something greater that binds the mind.
In fact, one of you seems to have connected with a very powerful mind.
I will smash your head in and break whatever spell you have cast on her!
We haven't even made a scratch on him...
Hmph! I expected more from the ones who defeated my sister.
Elena, you are carrying the last remaining essence of Ursena.
If you were to give in, you could hold tremendous power.
In fact you could join us in the creation of a whole new era.
We're finally in the palace of the deep.
This is it! Time to break some heads.
Stay on your toes, we will be facing tremendous resistance.
It is our birthright to usher in a new era.
We would be all powerful as an entity of eternity.
I am the Empress of the Depths, an immortal of the deep.
I have no need for your fantasies, Gestalt.
Even your power wanes as you have become complacent.
I think you would succumb to the power of Domiventus within a blink of an eye.
You do not speak of Domiventus!
No... You wouldn't even be able to take on Poseidon of Atlantis at this point.
Our time is running out, Elena is losing herself.
Eventually, Gestalt challenged Ursena, forcing her to exile.
Ursena believed if she took over Atlantis she could gain enough power to challenge Gestalt.
It does seem if we leave Gestalt unchecked he will use his power to slowly consume everything.
I saw a mention of a being called Domiventus in the memory.
We should not speak here, let's keep moving on.
Domiventus is a supreme being of an archaic cult.
The worshippers of Domiventus would attempt to cut all chains of consciousness to become a part of Domiventus.
Scholars have never taken the legends of Domiventus seriously, but not many scholars have spent time in the deep.
It is true. Summoning Domiventus is Gestalt's end goal.
Ursena wanted to defeat Gestalt because she feared the power Gestalt was channeling into this world.
At first, she was imprisoned by Poseidon when she tried to take over Atlantis.
But as Gestalt's power and influence grew in the deep, so did Ursena's, allowing her to break free and subjugate Atlantis along with Poseidon.
How do you know all this?
Elena has unlocked the rest of Ursena's memories.
This means that it will not be long before Ursena's memories devour her mind.
I can hold on a little while longer.
O Great Prince! I wish to inform you that the summoning has finally begun.
After all these millennia, the moment of time converging into timelessness is nearing.
The heroes break into the innermost sanctum.
Ah! Elena, have you made your decision?
I do hope you have chosen to assimilate with the memories of my dear sister.
There is only one path to perfection and that is for all the actors in this universe to become of single mind.
Sharing a mind with Ursena, you are peering into this new era firsthand.
I will not allow you to take control of my mind using Ursena's memories.
We are here to stop your madness!
Our friends and companions are the ones who make us who we are!
For the freedom to learn of the mysteries of this world.
We all have our individual reasons, but we will fight you as one!
No one truly receives the credit when they have overcome both the world and themselves.
So be it... Show me your resolve.
I feel more clearheaded, I think that did the trick.
Friends, it's finally time to return back to Atlantis.
Brave champions! You have once again done an immeasurable service to Atlantis.
We are truly in your debt.
I never would have believed that a whole different world existed below Atlantis.
We uncovered the mysteries of the deep.
Mysteries that were believed to be merely legend. This adventure was a treasure trove of knowledge.
We also defeated a world devouring eternal being.
What I'm wondering is, who became the new leader of the Deep?
Meanwhile in the Capital of the Deep
Oooh no no! Everything is fine here in Asgard.
Actually there is someone I would like you to meet.
Pleased to meet the heroes that once saved the Nine Realms.
This is Regin, a dwarf from Nidavellir.
Pleased to make your acquaintance, how can we help you?
There is a small familial squabble that I could use your help in.
We're having issues with my father, my brother and I.
Our father wants to disown us and keep his riches to himself.
And how can we help with that?
You see.. We want you to steal Regin's father's gold.
You are daring and perfect for the job I think.
I know it sounds dastardly, but I assure you that it is for a good cause.
My father has been hoarding this gold for hundreds of years. I would like to use this gold to help the citizens of Nidavellir.
I knew you were right for the job.
I have never heard of Nidavellir.
I'm not surprised. Not many have...
There are two hidden realms between Svartalfheim and the glaciers of Niflheim. I live in Nidavellir, a land as burning hot as Muspelheim ‚Äìif not even hotter.
Then there is Myrkheim, a land rich in gold but frozen akin to Niflheim. Even though Myrkheim is dwarven land, not many of us spend time there other than to mine gold and minerals.
I can't wait to see it with my own eyes.
And even though we're not in Nidavellir yet all manner of fiery creatures roam these plains.
It's one reason why we don't get many travelers visiting dwarven lands.
Also, the lava fields we have tend to be deadly for most beings from other realms.
It's easier for us to visit Asgard to do business.
How will we manage in Nidavellir if it is as hot as you say?
Oh, don't worry! I know how to keep you safe.
Curse you Regin! This is not the last time we fight.
She doesn't seem to like you.
Andvari will come around... She just blames me for losing her magic ring.
Did you have anything to do with that?
Only by association, I only showed the ring to Loki. It was Loki's idea to use magic to turn Andvari into a pike and...
Hey! If you ask me... It was Andvari who lost the ring in the river.
But enough about that! Nidavellir is right beyond that hill.
Regin, could you tell me more about Andvari's ring?
What do you want to know?
If Andvari desires the ring's return, it must be powerful.
Anyone who wields it is promised great wealth.
The power to turn lead into gold?
The Andvaranaut allows the wielder to read the market.
Imagine! You could become as wealthy as a king just by trading turnips.
Regin! Father wants you to come back home.
This whole rebel act is unbecoming of you.
We were cast aside by father.
I'm not going to grovel at his feet for his affection like you and Fafnir.
But I will not stay my hand if you won't listen to reason.
I should have known I can't defeat you...
You don't seem to be very popular around here.
It comes with the territory when you're a handsome rogue.
We have ventured far into the lava fields.
Don't worry! It won't get much worse than this.
This is the safest road for outsiders.
How are the people of Nidavellir able to withstand these scalding temperatures?
We have enhanced our hearts with Core technology.
I've studied magical constructs that are powered by Cores.
How have you managed to harness such mystical technology?
We are master craftsmen and well-versed in all magical technologies.
You absolutely have to share your notes with me.
These are super secret trade secrets...
...so if anyone asks you didn't get this tome of super secret knowledge from me.
I demand you return my ring to me!
Just the person I wanted to see.
Do not joke with me Regin.
Either you return my ring at once or offer equivalent compensation!
I wouldn't be able to make that money in a thousand lifetimes...
...and as a Nidavellian my lifetime is already really long to begin with.
Then pay with your life, you scoundrel!
We used to be such good friends...
You shouldn't let a misunderstanding get in the way of a beautiful friendship.
I will file a formal complaint to the King himself.
The King will sort you out.
If anything my father would demand Andvari's ring for himself.
How long until we reach Nidavellir?
We are almost at the gates.
Once we get there we should sneak in and try not to get caught.
The plan will make itself as we get there.
I know the city gates like the back of my hand.
Look! We are almost at the vaults of my father.
That was simpler than I thought.
I was sure we were going to get caught sneaking past the main gate.
We slipped right through under their noses.
Regin, you are more resourceful than I gave you credit for at the beginning.
You're not supposed to be in here!
There goes the element of surprise...
I guess we are fighting our way to the gold then.
If we're fast we can still make it in and out with the gold before my father's guard can muster their defenses.
Ott, we don't have to fight.
You could just let me go through and we pretend we didn't see each other.
If you leave now we can do that.
You just have to go before our younger brother arrives.
I am determined to get my father's gold.
Doesn't matter who gets in my way.
Good work, Ott. You found the intruder.
Shouldn't you be setting a better example?
I know you're after father's gold the same way I am.
Ott! Aethslegaur! Seize this miscreant at once.
We are surrounded by formidable adversaries.
Fafnir is dangerous. We best avoid him at all costs.
There's a secret passage to the vault nearby.
It's our best bet now that the kingdom is on high alert.
Do the guards know of the secret passage?
I doubt even my father knows about it.
We used to play as kids there with Ott.
Would Ott expect you to use the secret passage?
I hope it doesn't occur to him.
We don't have a choice, we must move now!
I knew the secret passage was the right choice.
Looks more like a maze full of narrow passageways.
Yes, the Nidavellian gold vaults are an extensive network of tunnels.
Very classical dwarven innovation and design, even if I say so myself.
Now! Let's take this left turn and...
Andvari, what are you of all people doing here?
Regin, I am disappointed in you.
I always had such high expectations for your future.
Father, what I'm doing is for the greater good of Nidavellir!
I'll have to stop your foolish ambitions for my gold here.
There is nowhere to run anymore, Regin.
We will let you return to your kingdom if you surrender.
We got this far, might as well fight and nab the gold during our daring escape.
Father! I will show you the truth.
The gold and treasure of Nidavellir...
All of it is mine! And mine alone!
We need to use some of the gold to aid those in need.
I will take the gold now.
Aethslegaur, gather our forces. We're leaving for my palace in Myrkheim.
...the king is wounded, but I believe I can heal him.
You are a true friend, Andvari.
Please, take care of my father. I am going to pursue Fafnir.
Ah! The air is fresh and the wind blows free!
A nice change of scenery to the heat of Nidavellir.
Enjoy it while it lasts, it's going to get dark soon and the temperature will plummet.
It's already oppressively cold in my opinion.
We should seek warmth and shelter.
There should be a camp for Myrkheim explorers nearby.
This is a great opportunity to gather supplies before we set off deeper into Myrkheim.
Good idea, the icy wastelands of Myrkheim are a harsh host for visitors. It's good to be prepared.
Do you know where Fafnir's palace is located?
If there is someone who knows Myrkheim, it would definitely be Snorri the Storyteller.
We shall set out to find him in the morning!
I've heard he lives around these parts.
Aren't these the guys who have been attacking us since we arrived in Myrkheim?
We will not allow you to proceed.
It is I, Regin Hreidmarsson of Nidavellir.
I am looking for Snorri the Storyteller.
I haven't had royal visitors since the first sagas were sung.
King Hreidmarr was betrayed by Fafnir and we're in his pursuit.
Regin told us that you know where his palace is located.
I know many things about Myrkheim...
...but I can't help you with your request.
All I can say is that Fafnir's palace lies in the heart of Myrkheim.
Deep within the ground from where the cold flows and envelops the land.
There has to be a way to get there.
Is there anything you know that could help us on our journey?
You would gain something invaluable from helping us...
By helping us you could gain another amazing story to tell.
I can take you to the heart of Myrkheim.
Ott, what are you doing in Myrkheim?
On second thought, I don't have time for this.
You attacked our father and stole his gold...
Do I look like I'm swimming in bling to you?
I'm half frozen and my boots are wet.
Besides, it was Fafnir who attacked father and took the gold.
I will drag you back to Nidavellir to face justice.
We are traveling towards the heart of Myrkheim.
I only wanted to steal father's gold.
I never wanted to hurt father despite our differences.
I want to believe you, Regin.
Myrkheim is treacherous, cold and dark.
We could use all the help we can get.
I need to speak with Fafnir.
Glad to have you with us, brother.
This frozen gorge will lead us to the uncharted parts of Myrkheim.
What thirst for danger would drive anyone to explore these lands... I don't know.
Someone explored this borderland alright! And on top of that, built a fortress in its heart.
We will find that fortress and return your father's gold to the people of Nidavellir.
You have my deepest gratitude for sticking with me all this way.
There seems to be a safe path this way.
I have never been this far in Myrkheim ever.
A perfect place to hide with a stash of stolen gold.
Did Fafnir plan to betray father all along?
I've just been thinking about all of this.
Why would Fafnir build his palace in the most remote area of Myrkheim?
I would much rather settle somewhere closer to Nidavellir...
...unless there was a reason not to.
This is as far as you will go.
...the usurper known as Regin and his band of brigands are ordered to surrender immediately.
Hreidmarr is still the king of Myrkheim and Nidavellir.
Without his gold Hreidmarr holds no authority.
So surrender now and bend the knee to the true king.
Maybe he will be merciful as you are his brother.
I will do no such thing.
This is your final chance to surrender, Regin.
I have a message for Fafnir.
You can tell him to kiss that gold goodbye.
Thr√≠valdi, let's be done with this honorless whelp.
You were part of the royal guard and betrayed your own king.
You have no right to speak of honor.
So it was you who attacked father!
They're running away with their tails between their legs!
If we follow them they will most likely lead us to Fafnir.
Great! We will finally finish this.
Regin, I wish to apologize for believing you were the one to attack our father.
Even though I'm the oldest of us brothers, I always looked up to Fafnir.
...I always thought that if I could be more like Fafnir then father would take me seriously.
All he truly cared about was his gold.
He had no space in his heart for his sons.
That may be true, but he still remains dear to me.
I can't believe a place like this existed in Myrkheim.
This place reeks of a curse most foul.
It feels like a mistake to have come here.
Let's create a diversion and face Fafnir while his men are distracted.
What if we can't catch Fafnir by surprise?
In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity. The Art of War.
I'm sure we will land on our feet no matter what happens.
As cool as a cucumber in the face of danger as always, Regin.
We haven't been fully discovered yet.
I heard there's been an intruder.
Yes, Regin and his gang of rogues have snuck into the palace.
So my brother followed me all the way here...
Find him and bring him to me!
I don't care what you do with the rest.
There is something wrong with Fafnir.
The curse shrouding this palace is emanating from Fafnir.
It's time to enact the plan.
Snorri and Ott, can you two create a distraction while we follow Fafnir?
Seems like Ott's distraction is working.
This is our chance to capture Fafnir.
Just give up and return to Nidavellir.
Brother, you should know your place.
You see, you have no chance against me.
I received it as a gift from Loki.
What? Why would he do that?
Loki believes it is time for a new king in Nidavellir and Myrkheim.
Does the ring contain some hidden power?
The Andvaranaut is a mere trinket that makes the owner rich.
It shouldn't have any other powers.
It's time to return to Nidavellir.
Also, you can consider the riches you stole now forfeit.
He crushed the ring in his hand!
Uh oh! I can't dodge the attack...
No one will take my gold.
It's just a bruise, I'll be fine.
I finally saw Fafnir's true colors.
I couldn't allow him to hurt my brother.
I felt an immense amount of cursed power.
Fafnir transformed after crushing the Andvaranaut.
I'll stay here and take care of Ott.
You need to stop Fafnir. This cursed corruption can't be allowed to spread from this palace.
Let's put an end to this!
I want you to amass our forces and prepare to march.
Once we take control of Nidavellir. We move for Midgard as soon as possible.
It is finally time for King Fafnir to reign over all.
Now leave me, I will return to my riches.
We are gonna put a stop to your plans.
To protect the realms and our friends!
You scum won't leave me alone!
For all the people you have hurt...
The cursed power is fading from the ring.
Let's take the gold and return to Nidavellir.
Did you have a thrilling adventure?
For sure! Anything less would be an understatement.
Loki, why did you give the Andvaranaut to Fafnir?
I thought it would be exciting to see what happens.
Fafnir almost launched an invasion on Midgard.
I'm sure Thor and company would have done something if that were to happen.
...But I wouldn't worry about that as it didn't happen.
I finally caught up to you Regin.
Andvari, I have something for you. Take this.
It's best the ring stays with you.
Peace has returned to Nidavellir and Myrkheim.
I'm happy we were able to help.
What are you going to do with the gold?
I will return to Nidavellir and with Ott we will use the gold to help our people.
Father is still recovering, so we will care for him.
Sounds like a new prosperous time for Nidavellir is about to begin.

Tower Event is unlocked on [#!]experience level {0}[#].

The goal of the [#!]Tower of Magic[#] is to climb the Tower as high as possible with the best possible score. Players receive exclusive rewards based on their ranking at the end of the event.


TOWER OF MAGIC FEATURES

All the Tower of Magic stages feature [#!]Magic Curses[#]. If a Magic Book is not destroyed in time, one of your Heroes will receive a [#!]Magic Curse[#]. Heroes that are Cursed [#!]{0}[#] times cannot enter the Tower of Magic battles again. However, Heroes of Magic classes (Wizards, Sorcerers, Druids and Clerics) can withstand [#!]{1}[#] curses.

After completing certain stages, you can choose a [#!]Blessing[#] to empower all your Heroes. Blessings are buffs that are active on all your Heroes in the Tower of Magic battles for the rest of the current event.


TOWER OF MAGIC SCORING

Leaderboard rankings are based on the [#!]highest floor[#] reached. The scores from both questlines ([#!]Normal[#] and [#!]Impossible[#]) are [#!]combined[#]. If players have reached the same floor, they are ranked based on their [#!]cumulative scores[#] from playing each floor. The scores are defined by the enemies defeated, speed of completion and the amount of Hero health left at the end of a stage. Big combos and great matches are also taken into account.

Stages [#!]cannot be replayed[#] after completing them successfully.

The goal of the [#!]Ninja Tower[#] is to climb the Tower as high as possible with the best possible score. Players receive exclusive rewards based on their ranking at the end of the event.


NINJA TOWER FEATURES

All the Ninja Tower stages feature [#!]Oni Curses[#]. If an Oni Stone is not destroyed in time, one of your Heroes will receive an [#!]Oni Curse[#]. Heroes that are Cursed [#!]{0}[#] times cannot enter the Ninja Tower battles again. However, Heroes of the Ninja family can withstand [#!]{1}[#] curses.

After completing certain stages, you can choose a [#!]Blessing[#] to empower all your Heroes. Blessings are buffs that are active on all your Heroes in the Ninja Tower battles for the rest of the current event.


NINJA TOWER SCORING

Leaderboards rankings are based on the [#!]highest floor[#] reached. The scores from both questlines ([#!]Normal[#] and [#!]Impossible[#]) are [#!]combined[#]. If players have reached the same floor, they are ranked based on their [#!]cumulative scores[#] from playing each floor. The scores are defined by the enemies defeated, speed of completion and the amount of Hero health left at the end of a stage. Big combos and great matches are also taken into account.

Stages [#!]cannot be replayed[#] after completing them successfully.

The goal of the [#!]Owl Tower[#] is to climb the Tower as high as possible with the best possible score. Players receive exclusive rewards based on their ranking at the end of the event.


OWL TOWER FEATURES

All the Owl Tower stages feature [#!]Owl Curses[#]. If an Owl Stone is not destroyed in time, one of your Heroes will receive an [#!]Owl Curse[#]. Heroes that are Cursed [#!]{0}[#] times cannot enter the Owl Tower battles again. However, Heroes of the Owl family can withstand [#!]{1}[#] curses.

After completing certain stages, you can choose a [#!]Blessing[#] to empower all your Heroes. Blessings are buffs that are active on all your Heroes in the Owl Tower battles for the rest of the current event.


OWL TOWER SCORING

Leaderboards rankings are based on the [#!]highest floor[#] reached. The scores from both questlines ([#!]Normal[#] and [#!]Impossible[#]) are [#!]combined[#]. If players have reached the same floor, they are ranked based on their [#!]cumulative scores[#] from playing each floor. The scores are defined by the enemies defeated, speed of completion and the amount of Hero health left at the end of a stage. Big combos and great matches are also taken into account.

Stages [#!]cannot be replayed[#] after completing them successfully.

The goal of the [#!]Tower of Styx[#] is to climb down the Tower as close to the underworld as possible with the best possible score. Players receive exclusive rewards based on their ranking at the end of the event.


TOWER OF STYX FEATURES

For [#!]each {0} floors[#], Heroes from [#!]{1} classes cannot be used in battle[#]. However, members of the Styx family can always participate in the battles!

Tower of Styx stages feature [#!]Soul Grasps[#]. If you let a Soul Grasp expire, it [#!]deals damage to one[#] of your Heroes. However, [#!]if you match[#] the Soul Grasp in time, being released from the Soul Grasp [#!]boosts the health[#] of the targeted Hero instead!

In the Tower of Styx you can also acquire [#!]Blessings[#]! After reaching certain floors, you can select a Blessing to empower all your Heroes. Blessings are buffs that are active on all your Heroes in the Tower of Styx battles for the rest of the current event.


TOWER OF STYX SCORING

Your [#!]score from each stage[#] is defined by the enemies defeated, speed of completion and the amount of Hero health left at the end of a stage. Big combos and great matches are also taken into account.

Ascending a Hero requires [#!]Ascension Materials[#]. Materials are earned in [#!]Battles[#].
Excellent work! We've now cleared the first [#!]Province[#].
I think this is the start of a great adventure!
Welcome to team editing for the [#!]Goblin Village[#]. Only Common and Uncommon Battle Items are allowed in this event, so choose them wisely!

Each Hero can only be used [#!]once[#].

After you start this battle, the Heroes in this Team cannot be used again in this Quest. You will need stronger Teams towards the end, so plan carefully!
This Quest has a [#!]Special Rule[#]. Read more here before starting your adventure!
Awesome! This [#!]House[#] gives us more room for [#!]Recruits[#].
Wow. I have no idea how we got here, but this place looks absolutely gorgeous!
Yes. And it looks like the streets are gearing up for a festival of some sort...
Welcome to the Return Pass. Your Premium Pass is now active. Take a look!

Fantastic pick!
Take on Return Pass quests and claim your chosen reward.
The Return Pass offers plenty of rewards... and the final reward is yours to decide!
The Return Pass is finished, but don't rest yet... the Path of Valor is here!
And don't tell anyone... but I slipped you a few Valor Points to get started!
Is that a bottle on the beach? There is a message inside!
This message is to you, faraway hero.
Something is terribly wrong in Atlantis.
Travel far to the Maelstrom Archipelago and you shall find a great adventure.
Commander! This is a call for action! Let's get moving as soon as we can.
Season II has [#!]Special Stages[#] that apply effects to your Heroes during the battle. Tap on the icon to know more.
A strange sound echoes through the Stronghold and the ground tremors!
A majestic portal has appeared... and it's inviting you for an adventure!
The markings on the portal say something about... the Nine Realms?
This is where the letter said to meet?
My friends! It has been too long!
Passepartout! But where are the others? The ones we are to safeguard?
Mister Fogg and his party await you at base camp. Come, come!
Oh, my friends, such adventure awaits us!
Oh, the beauty of the open seas!
It's so wonderful to bask in the sunlight after our recent adventures.
Yes, the Underwild was quite dark and damp. The food was pretty good, mind.
Uuh... I guess that's one way to describe what we ate in the Underwild...
...but the cave mushroom diet is not my thing!
Haha... Well... If you put it like that...
But all of that is oceans away now! We've sailed far from the caves of the Underwild.
In fact, I think we're almost at our destination!
Yes, that's must be Kemyth, the Dominion of Eternal Dunes! And that's where our next adventure will take place.
Let's get going then, shall we?
Tap an Amulet to equip or unequip it.

Great! You have now equipped your first Amulet!

Note that you can freely swap your equipped Amulets from here also later on.

Find the best Amulet combinations for each battle to improve your chances at winning!

You can see your Amulets here.

Tap the button to take a closer look!

You have discovered [#!]Amulets[#]!

Each Amulet has unique powers that can help you in Season V battles!
Select the Hero to [#!]Level Up[#] in the [#!]Hero Roster[#].
Let's ascend [#!]Sharan[#]. She's a [#!]Common[#] Hero with a maximum level of [#!]10[#].
One of your Heroes is hurt. Let's use a [#!]Healing Potion[#].
Let's add the new Hero to your team.
Use [#!]Gems[#] to skip waiting. It's free this time!
Skipping wait time usually costs [#!]Gems[#], but in the beginning of the game it's free.
Researching and crafting requires [#!]Ingredients[#]. Tap to research!
There is one more thing to do. Let's build a [#!]Forge[#] to craft helpful items for battle!
Let's train [#!]Heroes[#] out of the [#!]Recruits[#] we gained in the battle!
Guest Heroes will help you during [#!]Starter Quest[#]! At each difficulty tier a new team of powerful Heroes will assist you in your adventure.

Every mission completed gives you [#!]Starter Points[#], which unlock new [#!]Milestones[#].

 Every [#!]Milestone[#] gets you different rewards that will help you throughout your journey.
You will also be able to claim the premium rewards of already reached Milestones when you acquire a [#!]Starter Pass[#] later.

Welcome to [#!]Starter Quest[#].

Complete a quest stage to unlock the next one.

Completing all stages in a difficulty tier will unlock the next tier.
Starter Quest is available! Embark on this adventure with powerful friends and terrorizing dragons!
Well done! Let's head back to our base.
Let's return to the base, and build more!
Excellent work! We're making progress clearing the Province!
Great! There's plenty of room now for new buildings.
Upgrading the [#!]Stronghold[#] expands the base at certain levels, providing more room for buildings.
Let's [#!]summon[#] another Hero before we head into the [#!]Province![#]
Great! Repairs on the Stronghold are finished!

It's your turn now, Commander.

Keep completing [#!]Missions[#] and expand your [#!]Empire[#]!
The alarm is sounding. Quick, let's see what's happening!
We've collected enough Iron. Let's start the repairs!
You have a Trainer Hero in your roster. These heroes share significantly more experience, so be sure to use them for leveling up other heroes!
Having a powerful team is the key to victory!
Select the Speedups or Gems that you want to use for skipping wait time.
Tap the "Confirm" button to continue when you're happy with your selection.
Speedups allow you to skip waiting for timers.
This is your first [#!]Titan[#]! Fight side by side with other [#!]Alliance members[#] to defeat it!
Defeat Titans to increase your [#!]Alliance Score[#] and to earn awesome rewards!
Each Hero has a different [#!]Special Skill[#]. Special Skills can be improved as the Hero levels up.
Now you have to wait until the training is finished or you can use [#!]Gems[#] to skip.
Training recruits follows the same process as crafting Battle Items. Tap to research!
[#!]Troops[#] provide a boost to the Hero using them, increasing their [#!]Attack[#], [#!]Defense[#] and the chance of a [#!]Critical Hit[#].
Take the new Troop into use to increase the [#!]Attributes[#] of your [#!]Hero[#].
Note that the Troop and Hero [#!]elements[#] must match. Collect and equip powerful Troops to ensure your victory!
Your [#!]Troops[#] can greatly affect how well your [#!]Heroes[#] perform in battle.

After 3 battles, your Heroes start to weaken every time they fight against the Mythic Titan.

Their mana generation and attack is decreased.

Your Heroes are buffed when fighting the Mythic Titan for the first time!

Their mana generation and attack is increased.
After receiving an invitation from Ariel, our heroes return back to the lands of Atlantis to take part in the Atlantean Games, held every 100-years in celebration of the birth of Atlantis.
Little did our heroes know about the dangers that still lurk underneath the great halls of Atlantis... This is the untold tale of the Mysteries of the Deep.
The portal to the Nine Realms beckons...
A letter came through... it's from Loki!
He wants us to return to Asgard at once.
I wonder what is going on?
It sounds urgent, we should investigate at once.
A new story in Untold Tales has opened! Adventure awaits!

You can attack once with each Hero during a War. Having a large roster of powerful Heroes, and using them smartly, is the key to victory in Wars!
This is your first battle in a War. Make your teammates proud!
War battles are affected by [#!]War Rules[#]. Tap here to see how it works.
Each war can have different rules. Tap on the icon to know more.
Remember that you can attack several times in each War. You also get extra attack energy during the war!
Oops! The war already started! Let's try again before the next war starts!
Let's prepare a defensive team. You can later modify it if needed.
Great, you've got a defensive team ready. Remember that you can modify your defensive team before each war.
This is the Field of War. Here you'll see your Alliance members who have set up their defenses.
Now you're all set up for the upcoming war. Let's return here once the war starts!
Alliance War starts soon. You must prepare a Defense Team to help your Alliance in the War.
This should be a good opponent to start with. Tap on the [#!]Attack[#] button to engage!
The War is active and both sides are ready to prove their strength!
Helping your teammates in War is easy and always worth the effort.

MYTHIC WATCHERS

The Mythic Titan summons {FAMILIARAMOUNT} [#!]Mythic Watchers[#] every {TURNSDELAY} turns. {FAMILIARAMOUNTONBATTLESTART} Watchers are present when the battle starts.

[*] If the weak spot is on a Watcher, the Mythic Titan [#!]cannot be stunned[#], but the Watcher still takes increased damage.
[*] Watchers [#!]reduce any damage that would be dealt to the Titan[#] by taking a fraction of it themselves.
[*] Destroying a Watcher [#!]reduces the mana[#] of the Titan.
[*] Trying to steal a Watcher will kill it instead.
[*] Watchers cannot be prevented from being summoned.
